Prompt Level: 12.0 [SEP] Prompt: Write a blog post advising Arthur on his situation. Type in the input box. Write 50-75 words. Use your own words where possible. [SEP] Response: Arthur, it's normal that you are stressed with the new job. Be merciful to your self, it'll take a time to adjust oneself. Ask your manager or some coworker to be your mentor. Participate social activities and take part in the every opportunity to spend time with your colleagues.

Prompt Level: 15.0 [SEP] Prompt: Read Ken's email and then email Josh and Ken a third option. Use your imagination. You can create any facts about your city that will support your proposal. Type in the input box. Write 150-200 words. [SEP] Response: Dear Josh and Ken,

Thank you for your sharing about the current situation of our business. To be honest, I really love where we work because it’s in a fashionable district and I think it’s really important for us to keep in touch with fashionable customers.
However, we can’t tolerate the rent any more and I have to say that it’s not sustainable for us to keep the current business here. So, I propose an idea to save cost and improve the profitability of our business.
The idea is that we should close every shop and sell our products ONLY in the web platform. Through this, we can save cost incredibly and we do NOT have to suffer from highly expensive rent. The con of that is the lack of opportunity for customers to know our products. So, to enhance our brand value, we have to engage in PR more and more.

I hope this idea will help our business.

Thank you.

Yuji

Prompt Level: 14.0 [SEP] Prompt: You work for an electronics company and are preparing a speech for a celebration dinner. Include a greeting/opening, a part where you show thanks, and a conclusion where you try to motivate the staff. Type in the input box. Write 125–200 words. [SEP] Response: Dear Team,

I want to take a moment to sincerely thank each and every one of you for your hard work and dedication. Your passion, creativity, and commitment have been the driving force behind our achievements so far. I am truly proud to work alongside such a talented and motivated group of individuals.

As we move forward, I encourage all of you to continue pushing yourselves and aiming even higher. Our potential is limitless when we work together with focus and determination. Every effort you make brings us closer to our goals and strengthens our company for the future.

Please know that your contributions are deeply valued, and I believe in your ability to achieve even greater success. Let’s continue to support one another, challenge ourselves, and make this year our best yet.

Thank you once again for everything you do. Let’s keep moving forward together!

Prompt Level: 9.0 [SEP] Prompt: Write about a restaurant meal you had recently. What did you eat? Was the food local or organic? Did you have dessert? Make sure that every clause has a subject followed by a verb. Type in the input box. Write 100-120 words. This activity is non-graded. [SEP] Response: Recently, I ate in a restaurant in Cancun because i was in vacations with my family and this restaurant was in a resort, but we had to do a booking. And the restaurant was perfect for me because this place had a lot of steaks and the new york steak was delicious because it was a medium raw and combined with a salad, mashed potato and a glass of red wine.  And the last, I ordered a dessert and I ate a cheesecake because it is the best dessert for me.  In summary I enjoyed the meal and was a great moment with my family.

Prompt Level: 12.0 [SEP] Prompt: Write a blog post advising Arthur on his situation. Type in the input box. Write 50-75 words. Use your own words where possible. [SEP] Response: by Arthur Randolph / May 26

I'm at the end of my rope. I'm at a new job, and the office politics are awful! I don't know what to do. I actually like my coworkers and manager, but I'm just not fitting in.

2 Comments

Doris

Arthur, you've got to be tough. Play the game. You've got to actively participate in all social activities with your team. Praise people and make them feel good about themselves. Ask your managers to be your mentors and tell them their advice is really helpful. And if someone gets in your way, don't hesitate to stab them in the back. It worked for me!

Marty

@Doris: I don't agree at all, except about participating actively in team activities. I think if you treat coworkers well, they'll be good to you. What goes around comes around! Don't get angry or annoyed – get knowledge! If you can, get your manager to mentor you, but be honest about any weaknesses or things you don't know. You want to learn as much as possible. Ask questions, notice how things get done and update your skills.

Prompt Level: 7.0 [SEP] Prompt: Read the class assignment. Then write your response on the class discussion board. Remember to take a stand on the proposal and support your position with reasons and examples. Type in the input box. Write 45-70 words. Use your own words where possible. [SEP] Response: I believe that cutting physical education and sports classes in favor of test preparation is a misguided decision. Physical activity is essential for students’ physical health, mental well-being, and overall development. Eliminating these classes could lead to increased health problems, such as obesity and stress, and reduce opportunities for teamwork and leadership skills that sports often promote.

While preparing for tests is important, it should not come at the expense of students’ physical activity and social development. Instead of cutting sports, schools should strive to balance academic excellence with healthy lifestyles. Incorporating physical education into students’ routines helps improve focus, reduces anxiety, and boosts academic performance.

Prompt Level: 8.0 [SEP] Prompt: Recreate the confirmation email below. Use the notes to help you structure the email. Compare your text with the model. [SEP] Response: **Subject: Booking Confirmation for Your Stay**

Dear Ms. Gale,

Thank you for choosing to book your stay with us. We are delighted to confirm your reservation.

Based on the details provided in the online form, your booking is confirmed for 2 guests from janurary 1st to january 30th

As part of your stay, we will also be arranging your airport pick-up. Should your travel plans change, please do not hesitate to contact us.

We have received your initial payment, and the remaining balance can be settled upon arrival. Payment can be made via credit card or cash at the hotel reception.

We look forward to welcoming you!

Best regards,  
John Smit
Hotel Hilton

Prompt Level: 11.0 [SEP] Prompt: Listen to the two forecasts – a general one and a shipping forecast. What are the differences between them? Write 30-50 words. Type in the input box. [SEP] Response: The general forecast gives weather information for the public, focusing on temperature, rain, and wind in broad areas. The shipping forecast is more detailed for sea conditions, including wind speed, wave height, and visibility, specifically for sailors and coastal areas.

Prompt Level: 11.0 [SEP] Prompt: Write a paragraph about how media has changed in your lifetime. What media was important before? What do you use now, and how has it changed your reading habits? Pay attention to your use of commas, colons and semicolons. Type in the input box. Write 150-200 words. Use your own words where possible. [SEP] Response: In my lifetime, the evolution of media has been remarkable, transforming the way we consume information and entertainment.

Before the rise of digital platforms, traditional media such as newspapers, magazines, and television played a crucial role in shaping public opinion and offering daily news. People relied heavily on printed materials for information, often waiting for the next issue or broadcast to keep them updated.

Today, I primarily use smartphones and computers to access news and entertainment. Social media platforms, blogs, and online news websites have become my main sources of information. This shift has significantly changed my reading habits; I now prefer quick, digestible content over lengthy articles.

Overall, the transition from traditional to digital media has made information more accessible and immediate, allowing me to stay informed in real-time while also altering how I engage with written content. This evolution in media has not only changed the way I read but also how I engage with the world around me.

Prompt Level: 8.0 [SEP] Prompt: Now help the scientist with his scientific report by writing the abstract, which should include all of the report's essential information. Use the notes to help you. Write 100-150 words. [SEP] Response: Notepad

The Expected Effect of Sun Valley Dam on Local Sloth Species

Abstract
?

Methodology
Advanced PC simulation created to test how dam construction and completion will relate to overall sloth livelihood.

Findings
Simulation run repeatedly to determine effect of each variable (e.g. area of habitat, food variety, etc.) found that loss of habitat and reduction of food variety will be the main factors caused by the construction of the dam.

Conclusion
Two factors caused by dam construction (loss of habitat and reduction of food variety) will relate most to population decline.

Recommendation
Relocate local sloth species to neighbouring Corona Valley prior to dam construction to prevent ecological cataclysm and perhaps even extinction.

References
“West Indian Sloths and Two-Toed Tree Sloths: Megalonychidae”, Grzimek's Student Animal Life Resource, January 1, 2005.

Prompt Level: 16.0 [SEP] Prompt: Write a paragraph describing how robots are being used in your country. How do you feel about them? In what ways will they positively and negatively affect society? Type in the input box. Write 150-200 words. [SEP] Response: In my country robots are used in various fields. They are doing reptetetive and simple tasks in the automobile industry as well as more complex things while assisting in surgeries and patient care in hospitals. The last one will get more and more important with the increasing problems coming with skills shortage. 
In my personal life I have robots for cleaning the floor and mowing the lawn which reduces the stress having to do these tedious tasks by myself.
An other usecase I can think of is robots that serve as waiters in restaurants. Here I see their main purpose is to add a fun and special twist to the dinner experience rather than replacing a waiter. In general robots will become more and more relevant in all of these fields the smarter they get and the better they can react to their surroundings and interact with humans. For instance my robot that mows the lawn is of great help but needs my assistance from time to time when it gets stuck often at the same spots. Having sensors to recognize the cristical spots in the garden it could prevent the issues.

Prompt Level: 16.0 [SEP] Prompt: Write about buying a home and applying for a home loan in your country. How easy or difficult is the process? Are there a lot of forms to fill out? Is housing expensive? What are the interest rates? Do you need to use a real estate agent or mortgage broker? Type in the input box. Write 200-250 words. [SEP] Response: Buying a home in India is a significant milestone, but the process can be quite complex and time-consuming. The first step is to determine your budget and preferred location. Housing prices vary widely across the country, with cities like Mumbai and Delhi having some of the highest prices, averaging around INR 26,780 per square foot in Mumbai. Once you've identified a property, the next step is to apply for a home loan.

Applying for a home loan involves several steps, including assessing your eligibility, choosing a lender, and selecting the right loan product. You'll need to fill out an application form and provide various documents such as ID proof, address proof, income statements, and property documents. The lender will then verify your information and conduct a property valuation before approving the loan. Interest rates for home loans in India currently range from 8.35% to 14.50% per annum, depending on the lender and loan amount.

Using a real estate agent or mortgage broker can be beneficial, especially for first-time buyers. Real estate agents can help you find suitable properties and negotiate prices, while mortgage brokers can assist in finding the best loan deals and navigating the application process. However, their services come at an additional cost. Overall, while buying a home in India can be challenging, proper planning and the right assistance can make the process smoother and more manageable.

How are you?

As you know, I will be visiting New York next week, and would like to visit an important client, Christopher Biggins, at the Electronic Solutions company office.

I will have some free time on Wednesday (September 23rd) in the afternoon and plan to visit him then. Could you please send Mr. Biggins an email to inform him of my plan?

Regarding the details, I will write an agenda for my visit later this week. Please inform Mr. Biggins that you will send him this agenda by Friday.

Best regards,

Ms. Kerr,

CEO, Future Software Inc.

Prompt Level: 14.0 [SEP] Prompt: Now use your notes to write the next section of the exercise report. Include your observations and recommendations about psychological operations. Write the report as clearly and concisely as possible. Write 150-200 words. [SEP] Response: Exercise Report – Psychological Operations (PsyOps) Evaluation

During the exercise, psychological operations played a supporting but valuable role. Leaflet drops and loudspeaker broadcasts were used to simulate influencing civilian populations and enemy morale. The messages were well-timed and targeted, but their overall impact was limited due to insufficient coordination with ground units and a lack of real-time intelligence updates.

One key observation is that PsyOps personnel were not fully integrated into the planning phase, which led to missed opportunities for stronger influence during key moments of the exercise. Additionally, the absence of local language specialists reduced the authenticity and effectiveness of the messaging.

Recommendations:

Integrate PsyOps teams earlier in the planning process to ensure alignment with operational goals.

Increase use of real-time intel to adapt messaging as situations evolve.

Invest in language and cultural training to enhance message credibility.

Conduct joint rehearsals with ground units to improve timing and coordination.

Improving these aspects will ensure that future operations gain maximum psychological advantage with minimal resource investment.

Prompt Level: 8.0 [SEP] Prompt: Write a personal statement for a careers website. Give your job title and describe your long- and short-term career goals. State your time frame for your career goals and development plans. Write 80-100 words. Type in the input box. Use your own words where possible. [SEP] Response: I am an electrical engineer with experience in the fields of generation, oil and gas, maintenance, and renewable energy. I am improving my skills in automated systems for the design, simulation, and validation of computer models for renewable energy generation equipment, as I aspire to join a multinational company in the clean energy sector in the short term. In the long term, my professional goals are to provide consulting services on projects related to the integration and connection process to my country's electrical transmission grids.
In the immediate future, for one or two years, I will be focusing on improving my skills in engineering and technical support for foreign clients in the renewable energy sector. My hopes are to obtain a position as a technical support and engineering development engineer in the power generation sector.

Prompt Level: 14.0 [SEP] Prompt: Your boss has asked you to do an internet search. Read the email and the search results then reply giving the two best places to go and your reasons. You can include the links in your reply. Type in the input box. Write 80-100 words. [SEP] Response: After conducting an internet search, I recommend visiting the Shaniwar Wada Fort and the Karla Caves. Shaniwar Wada Fort is a historical fortification in Pune that offers a rich tapestry of the Peshwa era's architecture and history. The detailed craftsmanship and sprawling gardens are bound to leave a lasting impression. Additionally, the Karla Caves in Lonavala are ancient Buddhist rock-cut caves known for their intricate carvings and serene atmosphere. They provide a unique glimpse into India's spiritual and cultural past. Both places offer an immersive cultural and historical experience, making them ideal destinations.

Prompt Level: 8.0 [SEP] Prompt: Write a summary of the report in no more than 75 words. Compare your text with the model. This is a non-graded activity. [SEP] Response: This research examines changing leisure habits among Australian adolescents and their link to rising obesity rates. Using surveys and questionnaires, it found a decline in physical activities, increased screen time, and higher calorie consumption. The study suggests reintroducing physical education for ages 10-16 and emphasizes health skills education. It also recommends Parent-Teacher Associations include discussions on student well-being to address obesity through coordinated home and school efforts.

Prompt Level: 8.0 [SEP] Prompt: Write a summary of the logistics industry, similar to the one in the previous activity. Compare your text with the model.  [SEP] Response: Logistics management is the set of actions a company performs to move physical goods and raw materials from its warehouse to the destination, as well as returns management.

Logistics and sales management are interrelated. Not surprisingly, in a distribution company, it's impossible to separate them. But, regardless of the sector, if physical goods need to be shipped, it's a fundamental part of the processes.

These actions include planning and practical implementation. Therefore, they are usually supervised by management or department heads.

Prompt Level: 15.0 [SEP] Prompt: Apply the language you've learned in this lesson to a new topic: language learning. Write about issues and challenges that language students often face. Ask yourself guiding questions to help organize the writing. Type in the input box. Write 150-250 words. [SEP] Response: Language learning is a rewarding but often challenging journey. Students face a variety of obstacles that can hinder their progress. One major issue is lack of confidence—many learners fear making mistakes, which can prevent them from speaking or writing freely. This fear often stems from perfectionism or negative past experiences.

Another common challenge is limited exposure to the language outside the classroom. Without regular practice in real-life situations, it’s difficult to retain vocabulary and grammar. Learners may also struggle with pronunciation and listening comprehension, especially when native speakers talk quickly or use slang.

Motivation is another key factor. Language learning requires consistent effort over time, and students may lose interest if they don’t see immediate results. Additionally, differences in learning styles can affect progress—some students thrive with visual aids, while others prefer interactive or auditory methods.

To overcome these challenges, learners can ask themselves:

How can I create more opportunities to use the language daily?
What strategies help me remember new words or grammar rules?
How can I make learning more enjoyable and less stressful?
By identifying their personal obstacles and experimenting with different techniques, students can build confidence and make steady progress in their language journey.

Prompt Level: 8.0 [SEP] Prompt: Write an email to the client, informing them of the sections that you have not yet received information on, highlight the importance of the information and request that it be provided as soon as possible. Use the notes to help you. Write 150-200 words. [SEP] Response: Subject: Request for Outstanding Website Information

Dear \[Client's Name],

I hope you're well. As we continue developing your website, we’re currently awaiting some essential information that is critical to moving forward efficiently.

Specifically, we have not yet received the following:

* **Purpose of the website**: Understanding your main objective will help us align the design and functionality with your business goals.
* **List of pages**: Please confirm which pages you’d like to include—e.g., Company, Product, Testimonials—so we can plan the site structure accordingly.
* **SEO details**: Keywords and meta tags are vital for improving search engine visibility and ensuring a smooth user experience.

These elements are key to building a well-structured, goal-oriented website that performs effectively. Without them, we risk delays in the timeline and limitations in quality and optimization.

We kindly ask that you provide this information at your earliest convenience so we can maintain our development schedule.

Thank you for your attention, and please let me know if you need any assistance in compiling the details.

Best regards.

Prompt Level: 6.0 [SEP] Prompt: Write about a company problem you are familiar with. Describe the problem. What possible solutions were there? Was a solution found? For reasons of confidentiality, do not mention a real company name, real people's names or real product names. Use general terms and descriptions instead. Type in the input box. Write 60-100 words. Use your own words where possible. [SEP] Response: This company was founded in 1932 by the carpenter Ole. For decades,  it was a growing toy manufacturer. In 1958,  the current brick format emerged,  making it a unique toy with unlimited  construction possibilities.  However , the crisis hit during the 1990s, when the rise of video games  captured children's interest. Seeing its market decline,  QS pivoted its project by increasing the difficulty of the game to make it more challenging for children. Prompt Level: 11.0 [SEP] Prompt: Now prepare the content for an informative web page about counterfeit goods. [SEP] Response: ⚠️ Counterfeit Products: An Invisible Danger

Product counterfeiting is an increasingly common crime worldwide. It involves the production and sale of unauthorized copies of items that attempt to imitate genuine products. While they may seem harmless at first glance, counterfeit products pose serious risks to consumers and have negative impacts on society.

🛍️ What Products Are Commonly Counterfeited?

Various types of goods can be targets of counterfeiting, such as:

Designer clothing, bags, shoes, and accessories

Watches, cell phones, and high-value electronics

Cosmetics and perfumes

Medicines, supplements, and health items (such as blood glucose test strips)

CDs, DVDs, software, and books

Alcoholic beverages and cigarettes

💥 The Impacts of Counterfeiting on Society

Counterfeiting goes far beyond simple copying. It:

Financing organized crime and smuggling networks

Possesses consumers' health, especially in the case of adulterated medicines or cosmetics

Harms legitimate businesses, reduces formal employment, and hinders economic growth

Provokes tax evasion, resulting in millions in losses to the public coffers

🔎 How to Identify a Counterfeit Product?

Price well below normal

Packaging with writing errors, fake seals, or a questionable appearance

Lack of manufacturer or seller contact information

Unsafe websites, with no reputation or security certifications

✅ What to Do if You Find Counterfeit Products?

Do not buy and report them. Report them to local authorities or Procon (National Consumer Protection Agency).

Avoid risks. Buy only from trusted stores or authorized distributors.

Spread the word. Share information with friends and family to prevent new victims.

Counterfeiting is a crime. Value your safety and help combat this problem!

Prompt Level: 8.0 [SEP] Prompt: Your teacher has asked you to write a short text about the parts of an airplane. Explain what each of the different parts are for, including the fuselage, wings, tail and engines. Write 150-200 words. [SEP] Response: An airplane is made up of several key parts, each with its own important function. The fuselage is the central body of the airplane, where the cockpit, passengers, and cargo are located. It connects all the other parts of the airplane and provides structural support1.

The wings are attached to the fuselage and are the primary lift-generating surfaces. They house control surfaces like ailerons, flaps, and slats, which help control the airplane's movement12.

The tail, also known as the empennage, includes the horizontal and vertical stabilizers. These stabilizers provide stability and control, keeping the airplane flying straight. The horizontal stabilizer prevents up-and-down motion (pitch), while the vertical stabilizer prevents side-to-side motion (yaw)2.

Finally, the engines provide the thrust needed to push the airplane forward through the air. They can be turbine engines or propellers, depending on the type of airplane.

I love the airplanes.

Ship’s Position: Indicate the current coordinates (latitude and longitude).
Ship’s Speed and Movements: Note the current speed and any changes in course or maneuvers.
Vessel’s Draft: Report the current draft forward and aft.
Traffic in the Area: Mention any nearby vessels, including their positions and movements.
State of the Equipment: Detail the condition of equipment on the bridge and in the engine room.
Navigational Aids: Confirm that all navigational aids (GPS, radar, etc.) are functioning correctly.
Radiocommunications: Update on any ongoing or expected communications.
Weather Conditions: Report the current weather, including wind speed, direction, and visibility.

Other Special Events: Note any significant occurrences or operations.
The Logs: Ensure all logs are up-to-date and accurately reflect the current situation.
This comprehensive handover ensures a smooth transition and maintains the ship's operational integrity.

Prompt Level: 13.0 [SEP] Prompt: Use the information in the notes to write an informative text about NAFTA, or write about a trade agreement your country is a part of. Type in the input box. Write 150-200 words. [SEP] Response: The North American Free Trade Agreement (NAFTA) is a trilateral trade agreement between the United States, Canada, and Mexico. Implemented in 1994, NAFTA aimed to reduce trade barriers and facilitate the exchange of goods and services among its member countries.

NAFTA has had a significant impact on the economies of its member countries. The agreement has increased trade volumes, economic growth, and investment opportunities. For example, trade between the US and Mexico has grown from $81 billion in 1993 to over $600 billion today.

Key provisions of NAFTA include:

- Tariff reduction and elimination
- Simplified customs procedures
- Protection of intellectual property rights
- Dispute resolution mechanisms

While NAFTA has faced criticism and challenges, it remains an important trade agreement for North America. Its impact on regional economic integration and cooperation has been substantial, and it continues to shape trade policies and practices in the region.

In 2020, NAFTA was replaced by the United States-Mexico-Canada Agreement (USMCA), which builds upon the foundation established by NAFTA and addresses new trade issues, such as digital trade and labor rights.

Prompt Level: 11.0 [SEP] Prompt: Now prepare the content for an informative web page about counterfeit goods. Be sure to keep the following points in mind: Types of counterfeit goods, the effect of counterfeiting on society, the signs of a fake, what to do if you discover fake goods.  Write 250-300 words. [SEP] Response: How to find counterfeit goods

Here is the way to find counterfeit goods when you do shopping.
Be aware of those statements and call the police as soon as you think you accidentally perchaced counterfeit goods.

Counterfeit goods are anywhere in the world these days. They are fake products designed to imitate genuine items such as luxury fashin, electronics, CDs, DVDs, medicines, and even food. While they may seem like a bargein, they come with serious risks. We should know that.

The Impact of Counterfeit Goods on Society
Counterfeiting harms businesses by reducing sales and damaging brand reputation. Governments lose tax revenue, affecting public services. More importantly, counterfeit goods can be dangerous—fake medicines may contain harmful substances, and counterfeit electronics often fail safety standards. Additionally, counterfeit trade is linked to organized crime, funding illegal activities.

How to recognize a Fake?
Recognizing counterfeit goods is crucial. Signs include poor-quality materials, incorrect logos, and suspiciously low prices. Authentic products often have serial numbers, security tags, or certificates of authenticity. If a deal seems too good to be true, it likely is. Check the website of the company (shopping site) who runs the business. You can check the comments form the viewers or customers as well.
You can find some negative comments from there and find out if it's suspecious.

What to Do If You Discover Counterfeit Goods
If you suspect a product is fake, avoid buying it. Report counterfeit goods to brand owners, consumer protection agencies, or law enforcement. Purchasing fake goods supports illegal trade and harms businesses. By spreading awareness, you can help prevent counterfeiting.

Staying informed protects both consumers and businesses. Choose authenticity and contribute to a safer marketplace.

Prompt Level: 8.0 [SEP] Prompt: Write a summary of the report in no more than 75 words. Compare your text with the model. This is a non-graded activity. [SEP] Response: First: the Title page. Include the title of the project, your name, the date the report has been published, and don’t forget your funding organization or client. (See example, bottom left.)

Next, you’ll need a Table of Contents page. This is where you list the different sections of the report along with the page numbers. (See example, bottom right.)

This next section is where you have some flexibility. If you want to acknowledge anyone in particular, or the funding organization itself, then you can do it here. Keep your audience in mind at all times, and what you want the report to accomplish for you and your client.

Acknowledgements are optional; your abstract is not. This is a one-page summary of the whole project - its purpose, research questions and methodologies, results, conclusions and/or recommendations.

Now discuss the background to the project, and any relevant literature or studies that have informed your work. This is often important to clients, and it certainly is to other researchers who’ve gone before you.

After that, introduce the methodologies you used to collect your data. Describe the data-gathering tools you used and analyze any problems you encountered on the way. Reflecting on what was effective and what went wrong is an important part of the wider process.

Your findings are set out in the ‘data and analysis’ section. You can use visual aids such as pie charts, graphs or tables, just as long as you lay out the data clearly and let the facts speak for themselves.

Your recommendations should be to the point. Your client may want to act on these in the future, so it’s important to be clear and concise.

The final sections are a bibliography, laid out in alphabetical order, of all the materials you used in the course of your research, followed by the appendices, labeled and numbered neatly, with copies of any surveys, questionnaires, data charts and questionnaire responses you may have used.

Prompt Level: 16.0 [SEP] Prompt: Write a description of a legendary creature that’s popular in your country, or one you find interesting. Type in the input box. Write 150-200 words. [SEP] Response: One of the most fascinating legendary creatures from India is the **Naga**, a serpent deity revered in Hindu and Buddhist traditions. Nagas are often depicted as half-human, half-serpent beings, possessing immense power and wisdom. They are believed to reside in the underworld, guarding treasures and sacred knowledge.

Nagas are both revered and feared. In Hindu mythology, they are associated with water bodies like rivers, lakes, and seas, and are considered protectors of these natural resources. They are also linked to fertility and prosperity, often invoked in rituals for rain and good harvests.

In Buddhist lore, Nagas are seen as protectors of the Buddha and his teachings. One famous story tells of the Naga king Mucalinda, who shielded the Buddha from a storm by coiling around him and spreading his hood to provide shelter.

Despite their fearsome appearance, Nagas are generally benevolent, rewarding those who respect them and punishing those who desecrate their domains. Their dual nature as both protectors and potential threats makes them a captivating subject in Indian folklore and mythology.

Prompt Level: 8.0 [SEP] Prompt: Your teacher has asked you to write a short text about the parts of an airplane. Explain what each of the different parts are for, including the fuselage, wings, tail and engines. Write 150-200 words. [SEP] Response: The main body of an aircraft is known as the fuselage. It typically has a long, narrow, tubular shape designed to minimize air resistance and enhance aerodynamic efficiency. Inside the fuselage is the cabin, where the flight crew and passengers are accommodated throughout the journey. The landing gear is housed in the lower section of the fuselage and can be retracted after takeoff and deployed again during landing.

Extending from either side of the fuselage are the wings, which are fundamental to generating lift. They are slightly curved—a design feature known as an airfoil—that allows air to move more quickly over the top surface than the bottom, creating the lift necessary for flight. Attached to the rear edge of the wings are flaps, which are hinged control surfaces. When lowered, flaps increase the curvature and surface area of the wing, enhancing lift during critical phases such as takeoff and landing.

The stability of the aircraft is largely maintained by the tail assembly, located at the rear of the plane. The vertical component of the tail is referred to as the vertical stabilizer or fin, which helps maintain directional stability. Attached to it is the rudder, a movable surface that enables the aircraft to yaw, or turn left and right, during flight.

Prompt Level: 9.0 [SEP] Prompt: Write about a restaurant meal you had recently. What did you eat? Was the food local or organic? Did you have dessert? Make sure that every clause has a subject followed by a verb. Type in the input box. Write 100-120 words. This activity is non-graded. [SEP] Response: Culture Corner: Eating out
You sit at a comfortable table, and your server immediately introduces herself: 'Hello. I'm Julia. I'll be your server tonight.' Don't be surprised if the server gives you his or her first name. Most restaurants want you to feel comfortable, so servers are often informal but polite.
Your server will also ask you a lot of questions about your order – questions like 'How would you like that?' and 'What kind of dressing would you like on the salad?' After you start eating, your server may also come back to the table several times, asking, 'How is everything?' Don't worry; that's normal. Tell the server what you think, honestly and politely. The server wants to make sure you get exactly what you want and that you are pleased with your food.
After you've eaten, you may still have some food on your plate. That's fine. Your server might ask 'Would you like to take that home with you?' If you do want to take the food home to eat later, the server will put the food in a package 'to go.'
Finally, it's important to give your server a tip before you leave. Servers usually expect a tip that is at least 15 percent of the bill, but customers sometimes leave a 20 percent tip for excellent service.

[SEP] Response: 
Positive thinking is more than just a mindset—it is a powerful tool that can transform your entire life. When you focus on the good, even in difficult situations, you train your mind to see opportunities instead of obstacles. This simple shift in perspective can improve your mood, relationships, health, and success.

People who practice positive thinking are often more resilient. They bounce back from failure faster and learn from their mistakes. They approach challenges with confidence and believe in their ability to grow and improve. This optimism creates a sense of hope that helps them keep moving forward, even when times are tough.

Positive thinking also affects physical health. Studies show that people with a positive outlook are less likely to suffer from stress-related illnesses. They often sleep better, have lower blood pressure, and enjoy better overall well-being.

Of course, staying positive doesn’t mean ignoring reality or pretending that everything is perfect. It means choosing to face life with courage and faith, trusting that things can get better. It involves gratitude, self-compassion, and surrounding yourself with supportive people.

You can develop positive thinking by practicing daily affirmations, setting realistic goals, and focusing on what you can control. Even small habits like smiling more or writing down things you're thankful for can make a big difference.

In a world full of negativity and pressure, choosing positivity is a powerful act. It can change your life and inspire those around you. So, no matter where you are in your journey, remember: your thoughts have power. Choose them wisely, and you can create a brighter future—one positive step at a time.

Confidential

PANTASIA – Background Information for Deploying Units

The situation in the Federation of Pantasia began to cause the international community concern a year ago when an election resulted in a vote to break up the federation and form two separate countries for its two main ethnic groups, the Alphas and the Betas. Fighting broke out for control of the mineral-rich Argos Region, as well as between certain minority groups who were made refugees. There is also evidence of an attempt at ethnic cleansing of a minority group.

Six months ago the military staged a coup to reunite the Federation. Although a large portion of the armed forces have returned to Federal control, elements have remained loyal to the new governments of Alpha and Beta. These armies have had small battles between themselves over disputed territories while resisting operations by the Federal forces based in Federal Territory.

Until a month ago the situation was a stalemate, however, the various factions have been rearming under the pretence of negotiations. Recently, strong leadership in Beta has resulted in a campaign that has pinned down Federal forces and Beta forces have also launched an all-out attack through Alpha territory to seize valuable land in Argos.

This has resulted in considerable civilian casualties, refugees and dislocation of population. There are reports of executions, rape, destruction of property and infrastructure. It is also believed that Beta has established concentration camps as part of its ethnic cleansing policy.

Apart from the problems of the ongoing conflicts, there has been the constant threat of hunger for the civilians in the area.  Earlier in the year the weather was unusually cold and dry, which resulted in crop failures. In recent weeks heavy rains have caused flooding and the destruction of bridges, roads and rail links, cutting off some of the most vulnerable villages.

As a result of the conflict and because of humanitarian concerns, Chapter VII of the UN Charter was invoked by a special resolution with strong rules of engagement (ROE) to impose peace, separate the warring factions and provide humanitarian care. An Implementation Phase, involving air power supported by ground troops, will be launched at 0600 hours on Monday unless the factions lay down their arms. This seems increasingly unlikely.

In addition to war-fighting the infantry units will be expected to conduct humanitarian operations, to protect people and improve basic facilities. The Implementation Phase is expected to last one month and then turn into a Stabilization Phase, although it is possible that the war fighting phase will last longer. During the Stabilization Phase, infantry units will be ensuring peace and security while a new government takes over and NGOs enter the country to assist the civilian population. Some units will also be involved in direct humanitarian work.

Confidential

This report presents the discovery of a new bird species closely related to the American Robin (Turdus migratorius). DNA testing revealed distinct genetic differences, confirming the new species' classification within the Turdidae family and Turdus genus. Morphologically, the new species is characterized by its slightly smaller size, larger bill, and rustier coloration in males. Prompt Level: 13.0 [SEP] Prompt: A website has invited you to write your opinion on the topic of corporate social responsibility. Read the postings before you begin. Remember the structure you've learned on how to construct an argument. Write 200-250 words. [SEP] Response: Corporate Social Responsibility (CSR) has become an integral part of modern business practices, reflecting a company's commitment to ethical behavior, sustainable development, and community engagement. The postings on this topic reveal a spectrum of opinions, ranging from enthusiastic support to skeptical criticism.

Proponents argue that CSR initiatives foster a positive public image, enhance customer loyalty, and attract top talent. Companies like Patagonia and Ben & Jerry's are often cited as exemplars, demonstrating that ethical practices can coexist with profitability. These businesses have successfully integrated environmental stewardship and social equity into their core operations, proving that CSR can be a win-win strategy for both the company and society.

Critics, however, contend that CSR is often a facade, a marketing gimmick designed to distract from less savory business practices. They point to instances where companies engage in "greenwashing," promoting environmentally friendly initiatives while continuing harmful practices behind the scenes. This skepticism underscores the need for transparency and accountability in CSR efforts.

In my view, CSR is not just a moral imperative but a strategic necessity in today's interconnected world. Companies wield significant influence and resources, and with that comes the responsibility to contribute positively to society. Effective CSR requires genuine commitment, clear goals, and measurable outcomes. It should be embedded in the company's culture and operations, rather than being treated as an afterthought or a mere public relations tool.

Ultimately, the true measure of CSR's success lies in its impact. When done right, CSR can drive meaningful change, fostering a more sustainable and equitable world while also benefiting the business itself. Therefore, companies should strive to move beyond superficial gestures and embrace CSR as a core component of their identity and strategy.

Prompt Level: 8.0 [SEP] Prompt: Write a summary of the logistics industry, similar to the one in the previous activity. Compare your text with the model.  [SEP] Response: Logistics Industry Summary

The logistics industry encompasses the planning, implementation, and coordination of the movement of goods, services, and information across the supply chain. It includes transportation, warehousing, inventory management, packaging, freight forwarding, and last-mile delivery. Driven by globalization and the rise of e-commerce, the sector plays a critical role in enabling trade and ensuring timely delivery of products to consumers and businesses alike.

Technological innovation, such as automation, real-time tracking, and AI-driven route optimization, is reshaping the industry by improving efficiency and transparency. Sustainability has also become a key focus, with companies investing in greener practices, including electric vehicles and carbon footprint reduction strategies.

The logistics industry is highly competitive and often sensitive to fuel prices, labor shortages, geopolitical risks, and regulatory changes. Despite these challenges, it continues to grow, driven by increasing demand for faster, more reliable, and cost-effective supply chain solutions.

[SEP] Response: Buying a home in the United States can be a complex and time-consuming process, but it can also be a rewarding experience. Applying for a home loan requires submitting a significant amount of financial information and documentation, including income verification, credit reports, and asset statements.

The process typically involves pre-approval, where a lender provides an estimate of the loan amount and interest rate. Once a property is selected, the buyer must submit a formal loan application, which may require additional documentation.

Housing prices in the United States vary significantly depending on location, with cities like San Francisco and New York tend to be more expensive. Interest rates fluctuate based on market conditions, but currently range from around 3.5% to 4.5% for a 30-year fixed-rate mortgage.

While not necessary, working with a real estate agent and mortgage broker can simplify the process and provide valuable guidance. Agents can help find properties and navigate local markets, while brokers can assist with loan applications and securing the best interest rates.

Be aware, do some research about the best Agents in your City. You must guarantee yourself the success of buying a house taking care of every step during the process.

[SEP] Response: Gemma Banks' Seminar on Leisure Trends in Seniors

Seniors aged 60 and older, equal male and female representation, covering ages 60 to 90.

Investigating the correlation between seniors’ leisure habits and their frequency of visits to doctors’ clinics and hospitals.

How:
Quantitative research using face-to-face interviews and focus groups, with 60 participants.

Research conducted in 2009 over one year.

Recommendations:

Recognize the high computer engagement of seniors and consider ways to encourage balanced physical activity alongside digital leisure.

Prompt Level: 15.0 [SEP] Prompt: Apply the language you've learned in this lesson to a new topic: language learning. Write about issues and challenges that language students often face. Ask yourself guiding questions to help organize the writing. Type in the input box. Write 150-250 words. [SEP] Response: Language students often encounter various issues and challenges that can hinder their learning experience. What are the most common obstacles? One significant challenge is the complexity of grammar rules. Understanding tenses, articles, and sentence structure can be daunting, leading to frustration.

Another common issue is vocabulary acquisition. How can students effectively retain new words? Memorization is often insufficient; students may struggle with using vocabulary in context, which can stifle their speaking and writing abilities.

Pronunciation also poses a challenge. Why is it difficult for students to produce sounds that do not exist in their native language? This can affect their confidence and ability to communicate effectively. Additionally, the fear of making mistakes often prevents students from practicing speaking, further impeding their progress.

Cultural nuances present another layer of complexity. How do language students navigate idiomatic expressions and cultural references? These elements are vital for fluency and understanding the context in which language is used.

Lastly, what role does motivation play in language learning? Students may face a lack of motivation due to slow progress or overwhelming material. It’s essential for educators to foster an encouraging environment and provide tools to address these challenges, making the learning process more enjoyable and effective.

Careers are available for school leavers with minimal qualifications and also for young people who have specialist skills or university degrees. It is unlikely that young people without qualifications will be promoted to the highest ranks. However, it is possible if they gain qualifications during their RAF career. They are encouraged to do so.

School leavers can apply at age 16 and learn a trade through on-the-job training.

Students who have stayed on at school and achieved pass marks or higher in national exams have an increased number of career options available. School leavers will join as aircraftmen or women and during their careers may be promoted to the highest non-commissioned ranks and, in some cases, become commissioned officers.

University graduates enter as officers. Sponsorships are available for students in the last two years at school and/or in university.

There are over 50 different careers in the RAF. Ask the young person about  interests and skills before giving advice about specific careers. Use the materials you have been given, which will help you match the young person with suitable jobs.

Many applicants are interested in jobs that will put them on board aircraft. Explain that this is more likely if the young person is a graduate or has specific qualifications. However, school leavers who join as non-commissioned aircrew (NCA) will train as weapon systems operators and will work on board fixed-wing aircraft or helicopters and may specialize in acoustics, electronic warfare or linguistics. The training for these jobs is up to three years. On completing training, there is automatic promotion to sergeant.

Young people wishing to become pilots can apply on leaving school at 17.5 years old or older. They must have good results in national examinations. Celebrities are often celebrated for little more than their superficial charm or attention-grabbing antics, which tend to overshadow genuine talent or meaningful contributions. Take, for example, someone like Kim Kardashian. While she has built an empire based on social media presence and reality television, her influence has often been marked by vanity and excess rather than any notable achievements. It creates a toxic cycle where fame is equated with success, while those who contribute meaningfully to society—scientists, educators, social workers—are ignored. The celebrity culture perpetuates the idea that being in the public eye is more important than cultivating wisdom or contributing to the well-being of others.

This shift has also led to a faster-paced consumption of information, as I quickly scroll through news feeds rather than taking the time to read long articles or books.

Prompt Level: 16.0 [SEP] Prompt: In the preceding units, nine writing techniques were introduced: metaphor, hyperbole, symbolism, free writing, focused free writing, loop writing, listing, questioning and cubing. Write a paragraph or two explaining which techniques seem most useful to you. Type in the input box. Write 150-200 words. [SEP] Response: Among the techniques introduced, **metaphor** and **loop writing** stand out as particularly useful to me. Metaphors allow me to express complex ideas in a more relatable and vivid way by comparing something unfamiliar with something familiar. For example, describing a difficult situation as "walking through a storm" instantly conveys the intensity of the experience, adding depth and emotion. This technique helps me engage readers and make abstract ideas more tangible, enhancing the overall impact of my writing.

On the other hand, **loop writing** has proven valuable for developing and refining my ideas. This technique involves writing freely on a topic and then circling back to earlier points, refining them as I go. It helps me uncover new insights and deepen my understanding of the subject matter, which is especially useful during brainstorming or first drafts. By constantly revisiting and expanding on my thoughts, loop writing allows me to create a more cohesive and well-developed piece of writing. Together, these techniques provide a powerful framework for both creativity and clarity in my work.

Prompt Level: 13.0 [SEP] Prompt: A website has invited you to write your opinion on the topic of corporate social responsibility. Read the postings before you begin. Remember the structure you've learned on how to construct an argument. Write 200-250 words. [SEP] Response: My Opinion on Corporate Social Responsibility
I strongly believe that companies have a responsibility not just to their shareholders, but also to society. Corporate Social Responsibility (CSR) is not just a marketing strategy or a trend-it's a reflection of a company's values and long-term vision.
Firstly, businesses do not operate in isolation. They benefit from public infrastructure, local labor, and government services. In return it's only fair that they give back to the communities they profit from. Supporting education, healthcare, environmental sustainability, and fair labor practices are just a few examples of how companies can make a positive impact.
Secondly, CSR actually strengthens businesses in the long run. Consumers today are more conscious than ever about where their money goes. Companies that are socially responsible gain customer loyalty, improve employee morale, and attract better talent. This leads to higher productivity and ultimately, better financial performance.
Critics argue that a company's only responsibility is to generate profit for shareholders. However, focusing solely on profits can damage reputation, invite public backlash, or even lead to stricter regulations. Being socially responsible can prevent these risks and ensure long-term stability.
In conclusion, CSR is not a distraction from business-it's an essential part of modern business strategy. Companies that embrace it are not just doing good; they are building a foundation for sustainable success.

Prompt Level: 8.0 [SEP] Prompt: Your teacher has asked you to write a short text about the parts of an airplane. Explain what each of the different parts are for, including the fuselage, wings, tail and engines. Write 150-200 words. [SEP] Response: An airplane is made up of several important parts, each with a specific function to help it fly. The fuselage is the main body of the airplane. It holds passengers, cargo, and the cockpit where the pilots control the aircraft. It also connects the other parts of the plane, like the wings and tail.

The wings are essential for flight. They generate lift, allowing the airplane to rise off the ground. The shape of the wings helps to create the necessary airflow for this lift. They also have control surfaces, like flaps and ailerons, that help manage the airplane’s movement during flight.

The tail (also called the empennage) stabilizes the airplane. It consists of the vertical stabilizer, which helps keep the aircraft's nose pointed straight, and the horizontal stabilizer, which prevents the plane from tipping forward or backward. The rudder and elevators on the tail control turning and altitude changes.

Finally, the engines provide the thrust that propels the airplane forward. This forward motion allows the wings to generate lift, keeping the plane in the air.

Prompt Level: 8.0 [SEP] Prompt: Use your notes to help you write the report. Make sure you follow the correct structure and conventions. Write 150-200 words. [SEP] Response: Assessing the Potential for Oil Extraction in the Alberta Oil Fields
Introduction
Alberta’s oil sands hold vast bitumen resources, presenting significant opportunities for extraction and market expansion. This report evaluates key economic factors influencing potential development.

Findings
Operating costs for extraction range between $6 and $14 per barrel for bitumen and $18 to $22 per barrel for synthetic crude. Supply costs are estimated at $14 to $24 per barrel for bitumen and $36 to $40 per barrel for synthetic crude. Alberta’s total oil supply was projected to grow to 3.9 million barrels per day by 2015, signaling industry expansion.

Conclusion
As traditional markets expand, additional market growth or entry into new markets will be required to sustain increased production levels.

Recommendations
To ensure sustainable development, key actions include:

Monitoring crude oil prices to assess profitability.

Acquiring further data to refine cost estimates.

Evaluating the expense of transporting skilled labor to optimize workforce allocation.

Initiating pilot testing to gauge extraction efficiency and financial viability.

Overall, Alberta's oil sands present lucrative opportunities, contingent on effective cost management and market strategies.

Write 150-200 words. [SEP] Response: The North American Free Trade Agreement (NAFTA) was a trade pact signed in 1992 by the United States, Canada, and Mexico. It aimed to eliminate most tariffs and trade barriers on goods, products and services exchanged between these countries. NAFTA came into effect on January 1, 1994, creating one of the world's largest free trade zones. The agreement facilitated increased trade and investment, contributing to economic growth in the member countries. However, it also faced criticism for its impact on employment and the environment. In 2020, NAFTA was replaced by the United States-Mexico-Canada Agreement. Supporters of NAFTA estimate that around 14 million jobs rely on trade with Canada and Mexico, with nearly 200,000 export-related jobs created annually. However, critics argue that NAFTA is to blame for job losses and wage stagnation in the United States, as it led to outsourcing and the relocation of manufacturing jobs to Mexico.

To start with, our new service has to be able to communicate with and integrate into the current mobile network technology. Finally, after having passed all of these benchmarks, we will be in a very good position to gain government approval.

They may also struggle with maintaining motivation and finding opportunities for practice. 
Specific challenges include:
Vocabulary Acquisition:
Building a sufficient vocabulary to express oneself fluently and accurately can be demanding, especially with the sheer number of words to learn and the nuances of their usage.
Grammar and Syntax:
Understanding and applying the grammatical rules and sentence structures of a new language can be perplexing, particularly when they differ significantly from the learner's native language.
Fear of Speaking:
Many learners experience a fear of speaking in the new language, stemming from anxiety about making mistakes or feeling self-conscious. 
Pronunciation:
Mastering the correct pronunciation of words and sounds can be challenging, especially for learners who may not be familiar with certain phonemes or sounds in the new language.

Prompt Level: 16.0 [SEP] Prompt: Write a description of a legendary creature that’s popular in your country, or one you find interesting. Type in the input box. Write 150-200 words. [SEP] Response: Navagunjara is a fascinating creature from the Indian epic the Mahabharata, especially in the version told in Odisha called the Sarala Mahabharata. This mythical creature is made up of parts from different animals, symbolizing the diversity and unity of life.

Navagunjara has the head of a rooster, the neck of a peacock, the back of a bull, the waist of a lion, the tail of a snake, and three legs from an elephant, a tiger, and a deer. It also has one human arm holding a lotus or a wheel. Each part represents different qualities, coming together to form one amazing being.

In the story, Navagunjara appears to Arjuna, one of the Pandava brothers, during his exile. While meditating, Arjuna sees this strange creature and is initially surprised by its unusual shape. However, he soon realizes that Navagunjara is actually Lord Krishna in disguise, testing his faith and understanding. Recognizing its divine nature Arjuna bows in respect understanding the deeper meaning of its form.

The story of Navagunjara teaches a lesson about unity in diversity showing how different elements can come together in harmony. This idea fits with the larger themes in the Mahabharata which celebrates the complexity and interconnectedness of life.

In Odisha, artists often depict Navagunjara in Pattachitra, a traditional style of painting on cloth. These artworks capture the creature's unique form with detailed and colorful designs reflecting its spiritual significance. Through these artistic expressions, the legend of Navagunjara continues to inspire people to think about the mysteries of life and the unity that connects everything.

The tale of Navagunjara is an important part of Odisha's rich storytelling tradition, blending myth, art, and philosophy into stories that share timeless wisdom and cultural identity.

Prompt Level: 13.0 [SEP] Prompt: Use the information in the notes to write an informative text about NAFTA, or write about a trade agreement your country is a part of. Type in the input box. Write 150-200 words. [SEP] Response: The North American Free Trade Agreement (NAFTA) came into force in January 1994, after years of negotiation, creating a trilateral trade bloc between the United States, Canada, and Mexico.
 Its primary aim was to reduced or eliminated customs duties among the members such as tariffs, and foster economic integration among the three nations. The NAFTA has had a profound impact on trade relations, especially in agriculture; for example, Mexican fruits and vegetables flow into the US.Additionally, NAFTA encouraged foreign direct investment, enhancing the competitiveness of industries within the bloc.
NAFTA also faced criticism. Critics pointed to job losses in certain industries, particularly in manufacturing, due to companies relocating to Mexico for cheaper labor. Environmental concerns and the exploitation of workers were also points of contention.
In 2020, NAFTA was replaced by the United States-Mexico-Canada Agreement (USMCA), which updated key provisions to address modern trade challenges. NAFTA remains a significant milestone in North American economic history, exemplifying the potential and complexities of regional trade agreements.

Prompt Level: 8.0 [SEP] Prompt: Your teacher has asked you to write a short text about the parts of an airplane. Explain what each of the different parts are for, including the fuselage, wings, tail and engines. Write 150-200 words. [SEP] Response: An airplane is made up of several key parts, each serving a specific function to help it fly safely and efficiently.

Fuselage: This is the main body of the airplane, where passengers and cargo are stored. It houses the cockpit, where the pilots control the aircraft, and the cabin, where people sit during the flight. The fuselage also supports other components like the wings and engines.

Wings: The wings provide lift, which is necessary for the airplane to stay in the air. They are designed to create a difference in air pressure above and below the wing, allowing the plane to rise. The wings also often have flaps and ailerons to control the plane’s speed, altitude, and direction.

Tail: The tail includes the horizontal stabilizer and the vertical stabilizer (rudder). The horizontal stabilizer helps keep the airplane stable in the air and prevents unwanted pitching movements, while the rudder helps control the plane’s yaw, or left-to-right movement.

Engines: Engines are responsible for generating the thrust needed to propel the airplane forward. Most airplanes have either jet engines or propellers that push or pull the aircraft through the air, allowing it to reach cruising speeds and altitudes.

Together, these parts make an airplane capable of flight, ensuring stability, control, and propulsion.

Prompt Level: 13.0 [SEP] Prompt: A website has invited you to write your opinion on the topic of corporate social responsibility. Read the postings before you begin. Remember the structure you've learned on how to construct an argument. Write 200-250 words. [SEP] Response: I strongly believe that companies have a responsibility to society beyond just making profits for shareholders. Businesses do not operate in a vacuum—they rely on communities for labor, infrastructure, and customers. Therefore, it’s only fair that they give back in meaningful ways.

Corporate social responsibility (CSR) is not just about charity; it’s about sustainable and ethical business practices. When companies invest in their communities, support education, reduce environmental harm, and treat employees fairly, they create a positive cycle. For example, offering fair wages and safe working conditions leads to happier employees, which in turn boosts productivity and reduces turnover. Similarly, supporting local education helps build a skilled future workforce, which benefits the company in the long run.

Critics argue that CSR is just a marketing tool or that it distracts from profit-making. But I see it as a win-win. Consumers today are more socially conscious and prefer to support brands that align with their values. So, CSR can actually enhance a company’s reputation and profitability.

In conclusion, CSR should be an integral part of every company’s operations. It’s not just good ethics—it’s good business. Companies that embrace their social responsibilities are helping to build a better, more sustainable world for everyone.

[SEP] Response: Leonardo DiCaprio has long positioned himself as a champion of environmental causes, using his platform to raise awareness of issues like climate change and deforestation. However, his pious posturing often rings hollow when compared to his personal lifestyle. While he endorses sustainability, he continues to travel the world in private jets and luxury yachts, burning more fossil fuels in a single trip than the average person does in a year. This glaring double standard undermines his credibility and raises questions about whether he genuinely cares about the environment or simply enjoys being seen as its savior.
Like many media-savvy celebrities, DiCaprio knows how to nourish a belief in his own virtue, carefully curating an image of activism while still earning big bucks from high-paying Hollywood deals and partnerships. Meanwhile, ordinary people are expected to make sacrifices - cutting meat, reducing flights, and consuming less -while he continues to live extravagantly.
Someone needs to take him down a peg or two and remind him that real change requires action, not just well-crafted speeches. If he truly wants to emulate a model of sustainability, he should start by practicing what he preaches. Otherwise, people will begin to bad-mouth his so-called activism for what it really is - hypocrisy dressed as heroism.

According to legend, the Monaciello is a guardian spirit of treasure, living in hidden underground passages or within the walls of ancient buildings. It is said to reward those it favors with hidden riches but can also play tricks on people by moving objects, spilling liquids, or creating mysterious noises. Some believe the Monaciello to be the ghost of a benevolent monk, while others consider it a fairy-like being tied to the earth and its secrets.

The Monaciello's dual nature has made it a symbol of fortune and chaos in Neapolitan culture. Tales of its antics continue to intrigue and entertain, reflecting the region's rich tradition of blending humor and mystery in its folklore.

Prompt Level: 11.0 [SEP] Prompt: You have been asked to create the content for a web page about counterfeit goods. To help you prepare, listen again to the Inspector talking about ways to combat counterfeiting. What does he say companies can do to fight counterfeiting? What can the public do? [SEP] Response: 

### What Companies Can Do to Fight Counterfeiting:

1. **Use Advanced Security Features**: Incorporate holograms, QR codes, or RFID chips into product packaging to verify authenticity.
2. **Register Trademarks and Patents**: Ensure intellectual property is legally protected in all markets where the product is sold.
3. **Monitor Online Marketplaces**: Regularly check e-commerce platforms and social media for counterfeit listings and report them.
4. **Work with Authorities**: Collaborate with customs and law enforcement to identify and seize fake goods.
5. **Educate Consumers**: Launch campaigns to inform the public about how to spot fakes and why buying genuine products matters.

### What the Public Can Do:

1. **Buy from Trusted Sources**: Purchase products only from official retailers or verified sellers.
2. **Check for Authenticity Markers**: Look for security features such as serial numbers or holograms on the product.
3. **Report Suspected Fakes**: Notify the brand or authorities if a counterfeit is suspected.
4. **Be Skeptical of Deals That Seem Too Good to Be True**: Unusually low prices can be a sign of counterfeit goods.

For the classification, suggest a name for the new species and say why it’s suitable. Use the email as reference.
Introducing the New Bird Species: Sylvaticus emeritus

Description and Comparison: The Sylvaticus emeritus is a recently discovered bird species that exhibits striking differences and similarities when compared to the American robin (Turdus migratorius). It features vibrant plumage with a blend of emerald green and deep blue, contrasting with the more subdued orange and gray tones of the American robin. Its slender beak and slightly elongated tail give it a more elegant appearance.

In terms of habitat, while the American robin is commonly found in North American woodlands and urban areas, the Sylvaticus emeritus thrives in dense, tropical rainforests. It prefers the canopies, nesting in tall trees, and feeding on a variety of insects and fruits, unlike the American robin, which often forages on the ground.

Zoological Classification:

Kingdom: Animalia

Phylum: Chordata

Class: Aves

Order: Passeriformes

Family: Turdidae

Genus: Sylvaticus

Species: Sylvaticus emeritus

Suggested Name and Rationale: The name "Sylvaticus emeritus" is apt for this species as "Sylvaticus" denotes its affinity for forested habitats, and "emeritus" signifies its distinguished and exceptional appearance among avian species. This nomenclature reflects both its ecological niche and its striking, regal presence in its natural environment.

Let me know if you need any further details or another topic to explore!

Prompt Level: 15.0 [SEP] Prompt: Apply the language you've learned in this lesson to a new topic: language learning. Write about issues and challenges that language students often face. Ask yourself guiding questions to help organize the writing. Type in the input box. Write 150-250 words. [SEP] Response: The Challenges of Language Learning: Overcoming Common Hurdles

Learning a new language can be an exciting yet daunting journey. Many students face a variety of challenges that can make the process seem overwhelming. What are some of these common issues, and how can they be addressed?

One major challenge is vocabulary retention. Students often struggle to remember new words and phrases. This can be mitigated by using flashcards, engaging in regular practice, and immersing oneself in the language through media like movies, music, and books.

Another issue is pronunciation. Many learners find it difficult to master the sounds of a new language, especially if they are very different from their native tongue. Practicing with native speakers, using language learning apps, and listening to the language as much as possible can help improve pronunciation.

Grammar is another stumbling block. The rules of a new language can be complex and different from what students are used to. Breaking down grammar rules into smaller, manageable parts and practicing them in context can make them easier to understand and remember.

Confidence is also a significant barrier. Many students fear making mistakes and feel embarrassed when speaking. It's important to remember that making mistakes is a natural part of the learning process. Joining language exchange groups or practicing with friends can help build confidence.

Finally, consistency is key. Regular practice is essential for language acquisition. Setting aside dedicated time each day for language study and practice can lead to steady progress.

Prompt Level: 16.0 [SEP] Prompt: In the preceding units, nine writing techniques were introduced: metaphor, hyperbole, symbolism, free writing, focused free writing, loop writing, listing, questioning and cubing. Write a paragraph or two explaining which techniques seem most useful to you. Type in the input box. Write 150-200 words. [SEP] Response: Among the various writing techniques, metaphor stands out as particularly useful for enhancing the depth and clarity of expression. By drawing comparisons between seemingly unrelated things, metaphors allow writers to convey complex ideas and emotions succinctly and vividly. For instance, describing a challenging situation as "navigating a stormy sea" evokes not only the turbulence of the experience but also the courage required to face it. This figurative language can create a more immersive experience for readers, enabling them to connect with the theme on a more personal level.

Additionally, symbolism serves as another powerful tool in writing. Symbols can encapsulate broader concepts within a singular object or action, enriching the narrative with layers of meaning. For example, a withering tree might symbolize loss or change, resonating with readers on a universal scale. By intertwining metaphor and symbolism, a writer can create a narrative that resonates deeply, inviting readers to explore the subtleties of the themes presented. Overall, these techniques not only enhance the richness of the writing but also foster a deeper connection between the text and its audience.

Prompt Level: 12.0 [SEP] Prompt: Write about how to develop leadership qualities. You can write about personal experiences or what you have seen happen in others. [SEP] Response: Developing leadership qualities requires a blend of self-awareness, continuous learning, and intentional practice. From personal observations and experiences, great leaders often share key traits: empathy, communication, adaptability, and integrity.

Empathy is foundational—it helps leaders understand and connect with others on a deeper level, fostering trust and collaboration. Communication is equally important, as clear, concise, and inspiring messages can guide a team toward shared goals. Adaptability allows leaders to navigate challenges and embrace change, while integrity ensures their actions align with their values, earning respect and loyalty.

Leadership often begins with self-leadership: setting personal goals, managing time effectively, and cultivating discipline. Feedback from mentors or peers can also highlight areas for growth. I’ve seen people who were once quiet and hesitant transform into confident leaders after committing to self-improvement and stepping into challenging roles.

I believe everyone has the potential to be a leader, but leadership takes different forms. Not all leaders are charismatic or outspoken; some lead quietly by example or excel in specific contexts. The key lies in recognizing one’s strengths, understanding others, and committing to growth. Leadership isn’t a title—it’s a mindset and a choice to influence positively.

This isn't just about nourishment; it's an investment in our collective well-being. Studies have shown that a healthy breakfast improves focus, boosts energy levels, and enhances overall productivity. By providing this vital meal, the company demonstrates a genuine commitment to employee happiness and success.
Furthermore, the breakfast room becomes a vibrant hub of social interaction. Colleagues can connect over a cup of coffee, share stories, and build stronger relationships. These informal interactions foster a more positive and collaborative work environment, ultimately benefiting both individuals and the company as a whole. This initiative is a testament to the company's understanding that a happy and well-nourished workforce is a thriving and successful one.
Key changes:
 * More engaging language: Used vivid imagery ("Imagine a morning..."), stronger verbs ("ushering in," "demonstrates a commitment"), and more impactful phrases ("investment in our collective well-being," "vibrant hub of social interaction").
 * Focus on benefits: Highlighted the positive impact on employee well-being, productivity, and company culture.
 * Concise and impactful: Delivered the message in a more concise and impactful manner while maintaining a professional tone.
I hope this revised version is more engaging and effective!
