Prompt Level: 14.0 [SEP] Prompt: You are completing a pre-inspection checklist for a dry bulk cargo vessel, Starlight. Make notes about any issues you noticed. Use the categories provided and type into the input box. Write 80-100 words. Categories: general cargo safety and stowage; staffing levels and working conditions; general condition and maintenance of the vessel; safety standards [SEP] Response: Understanding Counterfeit Goods

Counterfeit goods are fake products designed to mimic authentic items, often sold at lower prices to deceive consumers. These can include fashion items, electronics, pharmaceuticals, cosmetics, and even food products. While they may seem like harmless bargains, counterfeit goods pose serious risks to consumers and society.

Types of Counterfeit Goods
	•	Luxury Items: Fake handbags, watches, and clothing are common.
	•	Electronics: Substandard devices like phones, chargers, and batteries.
	•	Pharmaceuticals: Fake medications that may contain harmful or ineffective ingredients.
	•	Cosmetics: Unsafe beauty products made without regulation.
	•	Food Products: Counterfeit food and beverages that risk health and safety.

Effects of Counterfeiting on Society

Counterfeiting undermines legitimate businesses, resulting in job losses and reduced economic growth. Governments lose tax revenue, impacting public services. Additionally, counterfeit goods can endanger consumers through poor-quality materials, electrical hazards, or harmful chemicals.

Signs of a Fake

To spot counterfeit goods:
	•	Price: If it’s too good to be true, it probably is.
	•	Packaging: Look for spelling errors, poor-quality printing, or missing labels.
	•	Seller Reputation: Avoid unauthorized retailers or online platforms without verified credentials.
	•	Product Quality: Check for differences in materials, stitching, or performance.

What to Do if You Discover Fake Goods
	•	Report the Seller: Notify the platform, manufacturer, or authorities.
	•	Avoid Purchases: Refuse to support counterfeit markets.
	•	Educate Others: Spread awareness about the risks of counterfeit goods.

By understanding the dangers and identifying counterfeit products, consumers can make informed decisions and help combat this global issue.

Prompt Level: 16.0 [SEP] Prompt: In the preceding units, nine writing techniques were introduced: metaphor, hyperbole, symbolism, free writing, focused free writing, loop writing, listing, questioning and cubing. Write a paragraph or two explaining which techniques seem most useful to you. Type in the input box. Write 150-200 words. [SEP] Response: Metaphor and hyperbole are compelling literary devices that enrich writing by adding depth and vividness. Metaphors create connections between seemingly unrelated concepts, offering fresh perspectives and insights. By saying "time is a thief," for example, a metaphor vividly conveys the idea of time stealthily taking moments from our lives, evoking emotions and reflection beyond literal descriptions.

Hyperbole, on the other hand, employs deliberate exaggeration for emphasis or effect. It captures the intensity of feelings or situations, making them more relatable and engaging. Phrases like "I'm so hungry I could eat a horse" illustrate an extreme level of hunger, adding humor or drama to the narrative.    

Together, these devices stimulate imagination and emotional engagement, allowing writers to express complex ideas in a relatable and memorable way. They transform ordinary language, making it more dynamic and impactful, which captivates readers and invites them to explore deeper meanings. a metaphor vividly conveys the idea of time stealthily taking moments from our lives, evoking emotions and reflection beyond literal descriptions.

Prompt Level: 16.0 [SEP] Prompt: Write about buying a home and applying for a home loan in your country. How easy or difficult is the process? Are there a lot of forms to fill out? Is housing expensive? What are the interest rates? Do you need to use a real estate agent or mortgage broker? Type in the input box. Write 200-250 words. [SEP] Response: The current situation of the Spanish real estate market is broadly characterised by the high demand for housing, especially new construction, and the shortage of supply. As a result of this mismatch between supply and demand, the price of housing continues to rise. The average price of new housing in Spain has reached €2,930/m² in June 2024, with large cities such as Barcelona (€5,262/m²) and Madrid (€4,493/m²) having the highest demand, the lowest supply and, consequently, the highest prices. All these factors, combined with the fact that the average salary in Spain is relatively low, around €2,200 gross per month, mean that most people have to apply for a bank loan to buy their home. 

In Spain, you can buy a home through real estate agencies or from individual to individual. Buying a property from an individual offers personalised service and saves on commissions, while real estate agencies offer expert advice and speed up the paperwork. 

Once you have found the perfect house, it is time to face the process of applying for a loan. The main requirements of banks when granting a mortgage have to do with the applicant's financial situation. In order to know the stability and good current and future financial solvency of the client, the bank asks for pay slips and work history, and checks that he or she has no other outstanding debts. 

A good tip when applying for a loan, is to compare different mortgage loan offers from different banking entities. During this process, you also have to decide which type of mortgage best fits your financial situation: 
- Fixed rate: the same installment and the same interest rate during the life of the mortgage. 
- Variable rate: the interest rate, and consequently the installment, vary depending on the reference index published by the banking entities, which is reviewed every 6 months. 
- Mixed rate: a fixed rate is applied during the first years of the loan and then a variable interest rate is applied.

Another aspect to take into account is the fees associated with the application and granting of the mortgage loan:
- Opening fee: paid to the bank at the beginning of the loan for paperwork and management.
- Account fee associated with the mortgage: opening an account, with associated fees, to manage the payment of the installments.

In addition, we must not forget that mortgages have a financing limit of up to 80% of the value of the property, as well as an amortization period ranging from 20 to 30 years. 

In short, taking out a mortgage is a long process that requires taking time to carefully study the options and possibilities in order to obtain the best financing.

Is housing expensive? What are the interest rates? Do you need to use a real estate agent or mortgage broker? Type in the input box. Write 200-250 words. [SEP] Response: Buying a home and applying for a home loan can be a complex and demanding process in many countries. The process often involves multiple steps, including finding a suitable property, securing financing, and completing legal formalities. Housing prices can vary significantly depending on the region, with urban areas typically being more expensive than rural locations.

Applying for a home loan generally requires filling out several forms and providing detailed documentation. Lenders typically ask for proof of income, tax returns, employment history, credit score details, and bank statements to assess the borrower’s financial stability. The process can feel overwhelming due to the volume of paperwork and the requirement for accuracy.

Interest rates fluctuate based on economic conditions, but they are often influenced by the central bank’s policies and market trends. Fixed-rate and variable-rate loans are common options, with fixed rates providing stability and variable rates potentially offering lower initial payments but with the risk of future increases.

Using a real estate agent or mortgage broker can simplify the process significantly. Real estate agents assist with property searches, negotiations, and legal formalities, while mortgage brokers help compare loan products and negotiate better terms with lenders. However, their services often come with additional fees.

Overall, while buying a home can be challenging, proper planning, understanding the requirements, and seeking professional assistance can make the experience more manageable and successful.

---

### **The Time-Travelling Robot**

In the year 2125, a brilliant scientist named Dr. Elena Martinez created a robot named **Chrono**. Chrono was no ordinary robot; it was designed to travel through time and observe historical events. Dr. Martinez programmed Chrono with a mission: to learn from the past and bring back valuable knowledge to improve the future.

#### **The Ancient World**

Chrono's first destination was ancient Egypt. It arrived in the bustling city of Thebes, where it marveled at the grandeur of the temples and pyramids. Chrono observed the construction of the Great Pyramid of Giza, noting the ingenious techniques used by the builders. It recorded the daily lives of the Egyptians, their rituals, and their advancements in medicine and astronomy.

#### **The Renaissance**

Next, Chrono traveled to the Renaissance period in Florence, Italy. It met with great minds like Leonardo da Vinci and Michelangelo. Chrono was fascinated by the explosion of art, science, and culture. It watched as da Vinci sketched his famous inventions and as Michelangelo painted the Sistine Chapel. Chrono gathered insights into the human spirit's creativity and resilience.

#### **The Industrial Revolution**

Chrono then journeyed to the Industrial Revolution in England. It witnessed the transformation of society as steam engines powered factories and railways. Chrono saw the challenges faced by workers and the innovations that improved their lives. It recorded the impact of technological advancements on society and the environment.

#### **The Digital Age**

Finally, Chrono returned to the late 20th century, the dawn of the digital age. It observed the rise of computers, the internet, and the birth of artificial intelligence. Chrono noted how these technologies connected people across the globe and transformed industries. It also saw the ethical dilemmas and challenges that came with rapid technological progress.

#### **Returning Home**

After its journey through history, Chrono returned to Dr. Martinez with a wealth of knowledge. It shared its observations, and together they worked on new innovations to benefit humanity. Chrono's adventures taught the world valuable lessons about creativity, resilience, and the importance of learning from the past.

Listen to Your Employees: If people feel like they are being heard, even when they are complaining, they will be happier and more productive.

Ways to Demotivate Your Staff:
Disrespect Subordinates: Treating them poorly because they are below you.
Take Credit for Their Work: Claiming responsibility for work done by your subordinates.
Lose Your Temper: Showing anger and frustration.

Feedback:
The content is clear and well-organized, making it easy to follow.
Repeating the same message multiple times is unnecessary and can be confusing. Stick to one version of the message.
Consider adding specific examples or anecdotes to make the advice more relatable and actionable.
Good luck with your team!

Best regards, EF student

Prompt Level: 8.0 [SEP] Prompt: Your teacher has asked you to write a short text about the parts of an airplane. Explain what each of the different parts are for, including the fuselage, wings, tail and engines. Write 150-200 words. [SEP] Response: An airplane is a complex machine with several important parts that work together to make flight possible.

The fuselage is the main body of the airplane, where passengers and cargo are located. It provides structural support and holds the cockpit, where the pilots control the plane.

The wings are crucial for creating lift, allowing the plane to stay in the air. They are designed with a specific shape to help air move faster over the top than beneath, generating lift. Wings also often contain fuel tanks and may have ailerons to control the roll of the aircraft.

The tail includes the vertical stabilizer (the fin) and the horizontal stabilizer (the tailplane). The vertical stabilizer helps to keep the airplane steady by preventing unwanted side-to-side motion, while the horizontal stabilizer ensures the plane remains stable in pitch, preventing it from climbing or descending unexpectedly.

Finally, the engines provide the thrust necessary for the plane to move forward. They push the airplane through the air and are usually located on the wings or the rear of the fuselage, depending on the plane's design. These components work together to keep the plane in motion and maintain control during flight.

---

### Automotive Industry Trends: Quick Summary

The automotive industry is rapidly evolving, driven by several key trends:

* **Electrification (EVs & Hybrids):** While EV adoption continues, there's a growing shift towards **hybrids** due to softening pure EV demand, offering a balance of sustainability and practicality.
* **Software-Defined Vehicles (SDVs) & Connected Cars:** Vehicles are increasingly relying on advanced **software and AI** for features, updates, and connectivity, meeting consumer demand for integrated tech.
* **Autonomous Driving (ADAS):** Full self-driving is still distant, but **Advanced Driver Assistance Systems (ADAS)** are becoming more sophisticated, improving safety and convenience.
* **Sustainability:** The industry is prioritizing **eco-friendly practices** across the entire vehicle lifecycle, from production to recycling, driven by consumer demand and regulations.
* **Supply Chain Resilience:** There's a move towards more **localized and diversified supply chains** to prevent disruptions seen in the past.
* **Evolving Ownership Models:** Beyond traditional buying, **Mobility-as-a-Service (MaaS)** options like car-sharing and subscriptions are gaining traction, especially with younger demographics.

Companies are adapting by investing in these areas, developing new technologies, and exploring diverse business models to meet changing market demands and consumer preferences.

Prompt Level: 13.0 [SEP] Prompt: Use the information in the notes to write an informative text about NAFTA, or write about a trade agreement your country is a part of. Type in the input box. Write 150-200 words. [SEP] Response: NAFTA: A Detailed Look at North American Trade
The North American Free Trade Agreement (NAFTA) was a groundbreaking accord between the United States, Canada, and Mexico, officially coming into force in January 1994. The culmination of years of intricate negotiations, NAFTA's primary goal was to dramatically reduce or completely eliminate customs duties among its three member states. This initiative aimed to foster a more integrated and fluid economic environment across North America.
NAFTA's impact was far-reaching, profoundly reshaping trade relations, particularly within the agricultural sector. A notable example of this transformation was the significant increase in the flow of Mexican fruits and vegetables into the US market. Beyond agriculture, the agreement influenced various industries by removing trade barriers, which theoretically made goods and services cheaper and more accessible across borders.
While NAFTA generated both positive and negative impacts for each of the participating countries, the general consensus among economists and policymakers is that, overall, it benefited all three members. It spurred economic growth, increased trade volumes, and led to greater specialization in production among the nations. However, it also faced criticism, particularly concerning job displacement in certain sectors and environmental concerns. Despite these debates, NAFTA served as the cornerstone of North American trade policy for over two decades until it was replaced by the United States-Mexico-Canada Agreement (USMCA) in 2020, marking a new chapter in regional economic cooperation.
Would you like to know more about the specific impacts of NAFTA on any of the member countries, or perhaps about the USMCA that replaced it?

Prompt Level: 13.0 [SEP] Prompt: Use the information in the notes to write an informative text about NAFTA, or write about a trade agreement your country is a part of. Type in the input box. Write 150-200 words. [SEP] Response: The North American Free Trade Agreement (NAFTA) was a landmark trade pact signed by Canada, Mexico, and the United States, which came into effect on January 1, 1994. NAFTA aimed to eliminate most tariffs and trade barriers between the three countries, creating one of the largest free-trade zones in the world. The agreement was inspired by the success of the European Economic Community and sought to boost economic growth and job creation through increased trade and investment.

NAFTA's main provisions included the gradual reduction of tariffs, customs duties, and other trade barriers over a period of up to 15 years. This allowed for duty-free access to a wide range of goods and services, fostering economic integration among the member countries. The agreement also included side agreements on labor and environmental standards to address concerns about the potential negative impacts of increased trade.

Despite facing significant opposition and political debates, NAFTA was generally seen as beneficial for the North American economies. It facilitated the flow of goods, services, and capital, contributing to economic growth and higher living standards. However, it also had its critics, who argued that it led to job losses in certain industries exposed to trade competition.

In 2020, NAFTA was replaced by the United States-Mexico-Canada Agreement (USMCA), which aimed to modernize and update the trade relationship between the three countries.

Prompt Level: 16.0 [SEP] Prompt: Write about buying a home and applying for a home loan in your country. How easy or difficult is the process? Are there a lot of forms to fill out? Is housing expensive? What are the interest rates? Do you need to use a real estate agent or mortgage broker? Type in the input box. Write 200-250 words. [SEP] Response: Applying for a mortgage in Argentina is nearly impossible. Due to the instability of our currency, banks do not offer mortgages. Moreover, people do not want to compromise their savings for twenty-five years as it is difficult to plan that far ahead. The history of our country has made us precautious: we save all our money in a foreign currency, do not keep it in the banks, and high inflation encourages us to spend instead of saving due to how quickly prices increase. Additionally, governments do not keep steady policies.  

Let’s imagine that mortgages did exist here, and were accesible, there would still be uncertainty. Let’s say that you manage to obtain an interview with the bank to apply. The banker reviews your bank statements, credit rating, and employment history concluding that you might qualify for a loan. However, they tell you that property values are in US dollars and that the loan is in Argentinian pesos. Therefore, if it happens that in between the time the loan was processed and you actually purchase the house, the foreign currency rate between ARS and USD dramatically increase, it might happen that the loan will not be enough to pay the property and the bank will not take any responsibility for that.  

Due to these facts and the government not promoting such loans, many people resign to rent an apartment permanently. In the best scenario, you can save enough money in USD over the years to purchase a property without a mortgage.

Prompt Level: 13.0 [SEP] Prompt: You are writing to Harry, a new manager in your company. He wants advice on how to effectively motivate his team and what strategies to avoid. Use the language and strategies you have learned in this lesson. Type in the input box. Write 150-200 words. [SEP] Response: Hi Harry,

Congratulations on your new role as manager! Motivating your team effectively is key to driving both productivity and job satisfaction. Here are a few strategies to help:

Set Clear Expectations: Ensure your team understands the goals and the purpose behind their tasks. This creates a sense of direction and accountability.

Provide Regular Feedback: Positive reinforcement is powerful. Celebrate successes, no matter how small, and give constructive feedback for areas of improvement.

Foster a Collaborative Environment: Encourage teamwork and open communication. When people feel part of a supportive team, motivation levels increase.

Empower Your Team: Allow team members to make decisions and take ownership of projects. This builds trust and boosts confidence.
Avoid these common pitfalls:

Micromanaging: Trust your team’s abilities. Constant oversight can lead to frustration and a lack of motivation.

Playing Favorites: Treat everyone fairly. Favoritism can harm team morale and create division.

Neglecting Well-being: Remember that a motivated team thrives when they feel supported in their work-life balance.

Best of luck, and feel free to reach out if you need further tips!

Best,
Astra

New York City and Los Angeles are two of the most iconic cities in the United States, but they offer very different lifestyles. New York City is known for its fast-paced environment and towering skyscrapers. The city is bustling 24/7, and there's always something to do, whether it's exploring Broadway shows, visiting museums, or simply walking through the busy streets. The energy of the city is contagious, and people often rely on public transportation to get around due to the city's compact nature.

In contrast, Los Angeles presents a more laid-back atmosphere. While it is a major urban hub, its sprawling layout and car-centric culture create a more relaxed vibe compared to New York. The city is famous for its entertainment industry, with Hollywood being the heart of the film and television world. The sunny weather and proximity to beautiful beaches also make Los Angeles a more outdoor-oriented city, with residents enjoying activities like hiking, surfing, or relaxing by the ocean.

While New York thrives on its density and constant activity, Los Angeles shines with its open spaces and focus on leisure. Both cities have unique offerings, yet they are polar opposites in terms of pace and lifestyle.

Prompt Level: 13.0 [SEP] Prompt: You are writing to Harry, a new manager in your company. He wants advice on how to effectively motivate his team and what strategies to avoid. Use the language and strategies you have learned in this lesson. Type in the input box. Write 150-200 words. [SEP] Response: Hello, Harry. 
This is Jose. Thank you for reaching out regarding your concerns on how to motivate your employees. 
Frist, I recommend you to follow the ABR system, which stands for: Analyze, Benchmark and Reward. Analyze refers to review the current status on your team, for each members, this will allow you to clearly communicate your expectations while motivating your team on the setting of their objectives (this will definitely boos their motivation); B stands for Benchmarking, that is connected with the previous task: involve your team in the goal, make them feel part of the process, and lastly: reward. This mean to ensure there is a reward after success, this mean monitoring your team's performance, asses it and reward when the benchmark is reached or surpassed. You can use multiple options, such as prizes, bonus or even vouchers. 
As part of your initial query, were are some behaviors you need to avoid: 
1. Lose your temper: although as a leader you will face stressful situations, keep calm, get together and then act. Remember good leadership lead by example. 
2. Don't let your team take blame for things: even if they commit an error, do nor focus on that but in how to improve, and
3. Avoid compliment: some leaders don't compliment their teams after a success as they don't want them to "do thing because of the compliment", ignoring the fact that positive words of recognition can boost your team morale while provide feedback on their work. 

To summarize the above, connect with your team to recognize their motivation and the proper way to approach them. 

Do not hesitate to reach out again in case further questions arise. 

Regards, 

Jose

If cargo is not properly secured, it can shift during rough seas, causing damage to the ship or injury to the crew. To solve this, the crew should carefully follow stowage plans, use strong securing materials, and check the cargo regularly during the voyage.

Another problem is pollution. Oil or waste can accidentally enter the sea, harming marine life. To prevent this, ships must use proper waste management systems, follow MARPOL regulations, and train the crew in environmental protection procedures.

Here's a more detailed look at customer preferences in the automotive industry:
Key Trends and Preferences:
Safety and Technology:
Advanced driver-assistance systems (ADAS) like automatic emergency braking, lane-keeping assist, and adaptive cruise control are highly sought after. 
Consumers are increasingly interested in safety features and willing to pay for them. 
Connectivity and in-car entertainment are also important, especially for multitaskers. 
Driverless or automated automobiles are also gaining popularity 
Sustainability and Electrification:
Concerns about climate change and fuel costs are driving interest in electric vehicles (EVs). 
Consumers are looking for "best of both worlds" solutions, such as full hybrids and range extender technology. 
Charging infrastructure and the cost of electricity are important considerations for EV adoption. 
Mobility and Convenience:
There's a growing preference for personal vehicles over public transportation, especially after the COVID-19 pandemic. 
Consumers are increasingly interested in online car shopping and flexible financing options. 
Car sharing and autonomous mobility solutions are gaining traction. 
Affordability and Value:
Affordability and value for money remain important factors in car purchasing decisions. 
Consumers are also more interested in used cars. 
Specific Vehicle Preferences:
SUVs, minivans, and crossovers are popular choices among family-oriented consumers, offering generous seating capacity and versatile cargo space. 
Consumers also value features like rear-seat entertainment systems and power-operated tailgates. 
Brand Loyalty:
Intended vehicle brand defection is on the rise around the world, signaling the need to build strong customer relationships.

Prompt Level: 13.0 [SEP] Prompt: You are writing to Harry, a new manager in your company. He wants advice on how to effectively motivate his team and what strategies to avoid. Use the language and strategies you have learned in this lesson. Type in the input box. Write 150-200 words. [SEP] Response: Dear Harry,

Congratulations on your new role! Motivating your team is crucial for success. Here are some tips:

Communicate Clearly: Ensure your team understands their goals and how their work contributes to the company's success. Regular updates and feedback are essential.

Recognize Achievements: Acknowledge and celebrate both small and big wins. This boosts morale and encourages continued effort.

Provide Growth Opportunities: Offer training and development programs. When team members see a path for growth, they are more motivated to excel.

Foster a Positive Environment: Create a supportive and inclusive workplace. Encourage collaboration and open communication.

Set Realistic Goals: Ensure that targets are achievable. Unrealistic expectations can lead to frustration and burnout.

Avoid these strategies:

Micromanaging: Trust your team to do their jobs. Micromanaging can demotivate and reduce productivity.

Ignoring Feedback: Listen to your team’s concerns and suggestions. Ignoring them can lead to disengagement.

Inconsistent Policies: Apply rules and policies consistently. Favoritism or inconsistency can create resentment.

Best of luck in your new role!

Sincerely,
Deepthi

Based on personal experience and observations of others, I believe that effective leadership starts with empathy and communication. Being able to listen to others and understand their perspectives is key to building trust within a team. Leadership isn’t about dominating conversations or making all the decisions; it's about empowering others to contribute their ideas and talents.

I believe everyone has the potential to be a leader in their own way. Leadership isn’t restricted to titles or positions—it’s about influence and the ability to inspire others toward a common goal. With the right mindset and effort, anyone can cultivate leadership qualities over time.

Prompt Level: 13.0 [SEP] Prompt: A website has invited you to write your opinion on the topic of corporate social responsibility. Read the postings before you begin. Remember the structure you've learned on how to construct an argument. Write 200-250 words. [SEP] Response: The Importance of Corporate Social Responsibility

Corporate Social Responsibility (CSR) is a crucial aspect of modern business practices. It refers to the ethical obligation of companies to contribute positively to society and the environment. In today's world, where consumers are increasingly aware of social and environmental issues, CSR has become more important than ever.

Firstly, CSR enhances a company's reputation. When businesses engage in responsible practices, such as reducing their carbon footprint, supporting local communities, or ensuring fair labor conditions, they build trust and loyalty among consumers. This positive image can lead to increased customer retention and attract new clients who value ethical considerations.

Secondly, CSR can lead to financial benefits. Companies that prioritize sustainability often find innovative ways to reduce costs, such as through energy-efficient technologies or waste reduction strategies. Additionally, socially responsible companies may attract investors who are looking for ethical investment opportunities, further boosting their financial performance.

Moreover, CSR fosters a positive work environment. Employees are more likely to feel motivated and engaged when they know their employer is committed to making a difference. This can lead to higher productivity, lower turnover rates, and a stronger sense of company pride.

In conclusion, corporate social responsibility is not just a moral obligation but a strategic advantage. By integrating CSR into their core operations, companies can enhance their reputation, achieve financial gains, and create a positive impact on society. Prompt Level: 8.0 [SEP] Prompt: Your teacher has asked you to write a short text about the parts of an airplane. Explain what each of the different parts are for, including the fuselage, wings, tail and engines. Write 150-200 words. [SEP] Response: An airplane is composed of several key parts, each serving a specific function to ensure safe and efficient flight. The fuselage is the main body of the airplane, housing the cockpit, passengers, and cargo. The wings are crucial for lift, allowing the airplane to rise off the ground. Attached to the wings are ailerons and flaps; ailerons control roll, while flaps adjust lift and drag during takeoff and landing.

The tail assembly, or empennage, includes the horizontal stabilizer and vertical stabilizer. The horizontal stabilizer helps maintain pitch stability, while the vertical stabilizer ensures yaw stability. The rudder, located on the vertical stabilizer, controls the airplane's left and right movement.

The engines provide the necessary thrust to propel the airplane forward. Modern airplanes typically use jet engines, which are efficient and powerful. The landing gear supports the airplane during takeoff, landing, and taxiing. It usually consists of wheels and struts that absorb the impact of landing.

Finally, the cockpit is where pilots control the airplane, equipped with instruments and controls for navigation, communication, and monitoring the aircraft's systems. Each part of an airplane plays a vital role in ensuring a safe and successful flight.

Prompt Level: 16.0 [SEP] Prompt: In the preceding units, nine writing techniques were introduced: metaphor, hyperbole, symbolism, free writing, focused free writing, loop writing, listing, questioning and cubing. Write a paragraph or two explaining which techniques seem most useful to you. Type in the input box. Write 150-200 words. [SEP] Response: For me the best techniques for a creative writing are questioning and cubing.
Questioning technique is a five-step process which allows you to: recognize the richness and diversity of your subject (exploration); gather as much information as possible about this aspect (discovery); make some sense out of the body of information you’ve assembled (classification); determine what you want to say to the reader, and the order in which you want to say it (selecting and ordering).

Cubing technique is when before people write something important they often start with pre-writing to help them organize ideas, outline and clarify their thoughts and sort through what they really want to write.
A cube can help a person to think about their topic. It can be observed and described from six different angles and a few minutes can be spent writing about each of these. Any six prompts can be used on the cube. As an example, the six sides of a cube can be: describe, compare, associate, analyze, apply and argue.

Prompt Level: 13.0 [SEP] Prompt: A website has invited you to write your opinion on the topic of corporate social responsibility. Read the postings before you begin. Remember the structure you've learned on how to construct an argument. Write 200-250 words. [SEP] Response: Is Corporate Social Responsibility Really a Duty or Just PR?

Corporate Social Responsibility (CSR) is often praised as a moral obligation companies have toward society. Supporters argue that businesses thrive because of communities, resources, and infrastructure, so giving back is a form of ethical reciprocity. By supporting education, sustainability, and social initiatives, corporations don’t just elevate their public image—they foster long-term trust and stability.

However, critics suggest that CSR is less about ethics and more about marketing. They argue that many companies adopt CSR to polish their reputation, not to contribute meaningfully. When CSR programs are poorly funded or disconnected from a company’s core values, they become hollow gestures. Moreover, focusing too much on CSR might distract companies from their primary role—creating economic value and jobs.

Still, CSR need not be a binary of profit vs. principle. In fact, strong CSR initiatives can drive profit by aligning business goals with societal needs. For instance, companies investing in green technology not only help the planet but also future-proof their operations.

In contrast to the view that CSR is mere PR, its real value lies in integrating social good with business strategy. If done authentically and transparently, CSR becomes a powerful force for both societal progress and corporate resilience.

During the training exercise, psychological operations (psyops) played a crucial role in influencing the local population and warring factions. Our observations indicate that effective psyops can significantly impact the success of military operations.

*Key Observations:*

- Clear and consistent messaging is essential to build trust and credibility with the local population.
- Psyops teams effectively utilized leaflets, loudspeakers, and social media to disseminate key messages.
- Coordination with other units and stakeholders is critical to ensure a unified message.

*Recommendations:*

- Enhance training for psyops personnel on cultural nuances and local dialects to improve message effectiveness.
- Develop more effective methods to counter adversary propaganda and disinformation.

[SEP] Response: Listing as a writing technique is a prewriting strategy where writers compile a list of words, phrases, or ideas related to a topic. this method helps with brainstorming, overcoming writer's block and focusing on a specific area for development.
1. Brainstorming - start by jotting down any and all ideas that come to mind about your topic, without worrying about order or relevance
2. unordered or Ordered Lists- You can create a list that is either unordered (like a bulleted lists) or ordered (like a numbered list) depending on the desired purpose
3. Narrowing focus- As you create your list, you can group related ideas and begin to see patter and connections, helping you narrow down your focus
4. Developing ideas: the list can then serve as a foundation for further development such as creating a more detailed outline or expanding on specific points. Benefits of listing are generating ideas,focus and organizing, overcoming block building existing ideas

Prompt Level: 15.0 [SEP] Prompt: Apply the language you've learned in this lesson to a new topic: language learning. Write about issues and challenges that language students often face. Ask yourself guiding questions to help organize the writing. Type in the input box. Write 150-250 words. [SEP] Response: Language learning can be both exciting and challenging. One common issue students face is motivation. It's easy to start with enthusiasm, but as time goes on, it can be difficult to maintain that drive, especially when progress feels slow. So, how can learners stay motivated? Setting small, achievable goals and celebrating progress can help.

Another challenge is the fear of making mistakes. Many students hesitate to speak for fear of sounding incorrect or awkward. This fear can lead to avoidance of conversation practice, which is crucial for improvement. To overcome this, creating a supportive and non-judgmental learning environment can make a significant difference.

Additionally, mastering pronunciation and accent is often difficult. Sounds in a new language may not exist in the student's native tongue, making it tricky to pronounce words correctly. What strategies can help with this? Listening to native speakers, practicing regularly, and using language learning apps can be effective.

Finally, understanding cultural context is key. Language isn't just about words; it's about communication styles, gestures, and social norms. Students should be encouraged to explore the culture associated with the language to enhance their understanding and fluency.

By addressing these challenges thoughtfully, language learners can make steady progress and enjoy the process.

Prompt Level: 16.0 [SEP] Prompt: Write a criticism of a celebrity. It can be a particular celebrity or the whole idea of celebrity in general. Use some of the language you have learned for criticizing in this lesson. Type in the input box. Write 150-200 words. [SEP] Response: Celebrity culture, at its core, often reflects a troubling distortion of values in modern society. It elevates individuals—frequently for attributes like appearance, charisma, or social media savvy—above others whose contributions may be more meaningful but less sensational. This elevation can foster a culture of superficiality, where public admiration is detached from merit or integrity, and attention is the ultimate currency.
The influence celebrities wield—social, political, or cultural—is frequently disproportionate to their expertise. While some use their platforms responsibly, others disseminate misinformation or reinforce harmful norms, protected by fame’s halo effect. In this way, celebrity can erode critical thinking and distract from substantive issues, replacing dialogue with spectacle.
The machinery of celebrity tends to commodify people, turning them into brands to be consumed rather than complex individuals. As a result, both fans and celebrities themselves can suffer: fans are fed an illusion of intimacy or idealism that promotes envy or dissatisfaction with their own lives, while celebrities often lose privacy and autonomy, trapped in a cycle of performance and public scrutiny.

Type in the input box. Write 150-200 words. [SEP] Response: In English, when using third conditional sentences (which describe unreal situations in the past), we can apply a structure called inversion to sound more formal or literary. Normally, the third conditional follows this structure:
If + subject + had + past participle, subject + would have + past participle.
Example: If I had seen him, I would have said hello.

However, we can invert the first part of this sentence by removing “if” and placing “had” before the subject. This is called inverted conditional and is grammatically correct and often used in formal writing or speeches. So, the sentence becomes:
👉 Had I seen him, I would have said hello.

This structure keeps the same meaning but adds emphasis and formality. The same rule applies with “should” and “were” in other conditionals:

Should you need help, let me know.

Were I you, I’d reconsider.

In short, “Had I seen him” is the correct and formal inverted form of “If I had seen him.”

Write 150-200 words. [SEP] Response: The North American Free Trade Agreement (NAFTA) was a landmark trade deal signed by Canada, Mexico, and the United States, which came into effect on January 1, 19941. NAFTA aimed to eliminate most tariffs and trade barriers between the three countries, creating one of the world’s largest free-trade zones2. The agreement facilitated the free movement of goods and services, leading to increased economic integration and trade among the member nations1.

NAFTA’s provisions included the gradual reduction of tariffs, customs duties, and other trade barriers over a period of up to 15 years2. It also addressed issues such as intellectual property rights, environmental standards, and labor cooperation1. While NAFTA significantly boosted trade and investment in North America, it also faced criticism for its impact on employment and wages in certain industries2.

In 2020, NAFTA was replaced by the United States-Mexico-Canada Agreement (USMCA), which updated and revised many of the original agreement’s provisions to better reflect the modern economic landscape

Write 150-200 words. [SEP] Response: The North American Free Trade Agreement (NAFTA), which came into effect on January 1, 1994, was a landmark trade deal between the United States, Canada, and Mexico. Its primary goal was to eliminate or reduce barriers to trade, such as tariffs, and to create a more integrated North American economy. Over time, NAFTA significantly boosted trade in goods like agricultural products, with Mexican fruits and vegetables, for example, flowing more freely into the U.S. economy. While the agreement brought many benefits, including increased exports and job creation in some sectors, it also had its downsides. Critics argued that NAFTA led to job losses in certain U.S. industries, such as manufacturing, as companies moved operations to Mexico to take advantage of lower labor costs. Despite these challenges, overall, NAFTA was seen as beneficial to all three countries by increasing trade, fostering economic growth, and encouraging investment across the region.

PANTASIA – Background Information for Deploying Units

The situation in the Federation of Pantasia began to cause the international community concern a year ago when an election resulted in a vote to break up the federation and form two separate countries for its two main ethnic groups, the Alphas and the Betas. Fighting broke out for control of the mineral-rich Argos Region, as well as between certain minority groups who were made refugees. There is also evidence of an attempt at ethnic cleansing of a minority group.

Six months ago the military staged a coup to reunite the Federation. Although a large portion of the armed forces have returned to Federal control, elements have remained loyal to the new governments of Alpha and Beta. These armies have had small battles between themselves over disputed territories while resisting operations by the Federal forces based in Federal Territory.

Until a month ago the situation was a stalemate, however, the various factions have been rearming under the pretence of negotiations. Recently, strong leadership in Beta has resulted in a campaign that has pinned down Federal forces and Beta forces have also launched an all-out attack through Alpha territory to seize valuable land in Argos.

This has resulted in considerable civilian casualties, refugees and dislocation of population. There are reports of executions, rape, destruction of property and infrastructure. It is also believed that Beta has established concentration camps as part of its ethnic cleansing policy.

Apart from the problems of the ongoing conflicts, there has been the constant threat of hunger for the civilians in the area.  Earlier in the year the weather was unusually cold and dry, which resulted in crop failures. In recent weeks heavy rains have caused flooding and the destruction of bridges, roads and rail links, cutting off some of the most vulnerable villages.

As a result of the conflict and because of humanitarian concerns, Chapter VII of the UN Charter was invoked by a special resolution with strong rules of engagement (ROE) to impose peace, separate the warring factions and provide humanitarian care. An Implementation Phase, involving air power supported by ground troops, will be launched at 0600 hours on Monday unless the factions lay down their arms. This seems increasingly unlikely.

In addition to war-fighting the infantry units will be expected to conduct humanitarian operations, to protect people and improve basic facilities. The Implementation Phase is expected to last one month and then turn into a Stabilization Phase, although it is possible that the war fighting phase will last longer. During the Stabilization Phase, infantry units will be ensuring peace and security while a new government takes over and NGOs enter the country to assist the civilian population. Some units will also be involved in direct humanitarian work.

Confidential

Prompt Level: 15.0 [SEP] Prompt: Apply the language you've learned in this lesson to a new topic: language learning. Write about issues and challenges that language students often face. Ask yourself guiding questions to help organize the writing. Type in the input box. Write 150-250 words. [SEP] Response: Learning a new language can be an exciting but challenging journey. Many students face common obstacles that can slow their progress or affect their confidence. One major issue is **fear of making mistakes**. Learners often hesitate to speak or write because they worry about being judged or misunderstood. But isn’t making mistakes part of the learning process?

Another challenge is **lack of consistent practice**. Language learning requires regular exposure and use, but busy schedules or lack of motivation can make it hard to stay on track. How can students build habits that support daily practice?

**Vocabulary retention** is also a common struggle. Students may learn new words but forget them quickly without proper review. Could using flashcards or spaced repetition systems help?

Finally, **listening comprehension** can be difficult, especially when native speakers talk quickly or use slang. Watching shows, listening to podcasts, or speaking with native speakers can improve this skill over time.

[SEP] Response: Buying a home and applying for a home loan in India can indeed be a multifaceted process, and its ease or difficulty depends on several factors.

Complexity of the process:
1) Documentation - This can include identity proofs, address proof, income statements, bank statements and more. Ensuring all these are in order can take time and effort.

2) Eligibility Criteria - Banks and Financial Institutions have specific eligibility criteria related to your income, credit score, age, employment, and existing debts. Meeting these criterias is crucial for loan approval.

3) Legal and Technical Aspects - Property valuation, legal verification of the property title, and registration processes are essential parts of buying a home. These steps often involve external professionals like lawyers and valuers.

4) Multiple forms : As the prompt mentions, there can be several fo0rms to fill out during the loan application and property purchase process. Each form requires careful attention and accurate information.

While its still not mandatory to use real estate agents, many people find their services helpful in navigating the property search. negotiation, and paperwork. Similarly, a mortgage broker can assist in finding the best home loan options and streamlining the application process. However, its also possible to buy property and secure a loan directly.

Prompt Level: 15.0 [SEP] Prompt: You're going to write about an interesting, fictional event that happened to a friend. Write your blog post. Type in the input box. Write 150-200 words. [SEP] Response: The Night My Friend Disappeared

It was the kind of night that felt like something out of a movie. My friend Liam and I had been planning a weekend road trip for weeks, but on the night before we left, something strange happened. Liam called me, his voice shaky. "I just saw something... something I can't explain," he said.

I thought he was joking at first. He'd always been the one to mess around with tall tales. But when I got to his house, he was pale, his eyes wide, like he’d just encountered something beyond his understanding. He explained that while walking home, he'd seen a figure in the distance—familiar, yet unsettling. He tried to approach, but the figure vanished into thin air.

We laughed it off at first, but when we checked his phone later, there was a photo—a blurry image of a person standing just a few feet away from him. I didn’t see anyone in the photo. We never did make that trip. I don’t know what happened to Liam that night, but he’s been different ever since.

We never spoke about it again.

The time management is one of the most crucial skills an individual can possess, impacting both personal and professional life. Prioritizing tasks and setting clear goals help in making the most out of the available time. Tools like calendars, to-do lists, and time-tracking apps can aid in this process. In the workplace, efficient time management leads to meeting deadlines, increased job satisfaction, and career advancement. It also fosters a sense of discipline and responsibility. [SEP] Response: I picked up Emily Henry’s Beach Read a couple of years ago when I found out she was a fellow Hope College alum, and there were a few references to unique Hope experiences, such as late-night donut adventures. I quickly became a fan. Her storytelling is unmatched and I eagerly await every new release. Last month, when she released Funny Story, I picked it up at my local bookshop that day and finished it within the week! Once again, her one-of-a-kind character building told a story I couldn’t put down.

I will give a bit of a disclaimer up front: this book did have a bit more “spice” than I would usually go for, but for me, the storytelling made the read worth it for me.

Daphne, a librarian, moved to her fiance Peter’s hometown of Waning Bay, Michigan to start a life together. Daphne adores the way he tells their love story, but their life together comes to a screeching halt when he realizes he’s in love with his childhood best friend Petra.

Daphne moves in with Petra’s ex fiance, Miles, so Petra and Peter can move in together, leaving Daphne and Miles to put their lives back together. Despite finding themselves in similar life situations, the newfound roommates couldn’t be more opposite. For example, Miles is neighborly and knows everyone in town while Daphne’s coworkers think she’s a secret agent since no one knows anything about her life. 

They do their best to coexist and avoid each other in the apartment, but eventually start to form a friendship due to their close quarters. Begrudgingly, Daphne agrees to let Miles show her around town, with a countdown to her eagerly awaited Read-A-Thon (the only thing keeping her in Waning Bay) and an unexpected plan to deceive their exes.

Daphne’s job as a librarian means several book references throughout the story, which warms my bookish heart. From a Station Eleven reference to alluding to the author characters from Henry’s Beach Read, these references are a bonus to help the reader illustrate Daphne’s personality based on her literary favorites. 

Both Daphne and Miles are surprised by unexpected visitors, which brings some bumps in the road for their relationship – and a full apartment which presents its own challenges. Again, their different life paths leave them in a similar situation: putting the pieces together from the relationships that have deeply affected their own stories. 

One of my favorite quotes which is perfectly descriptive of Daphne and Miles’ relationships with their exes and families, and affects how they view their relationship with each other, is Daphne’s advice on waiting.

“You can’t force a person to show up, but you can learn a lesson when they don’t.

Trust people’s actions, not their words.

Don’t love anyone who isn’t ready to love you back.

Let go of the people who don’t hold on to you.

Don’t wait on anyone who’s in no rush to get to you.”

Should it be the American flag with two additional stars, or should it include the Canadian maple leaf and the eagle on a cactus eating a snake as part of the design (as small icons)? I can imagine it could be divided into three equal parts to symbolize that each party has the same rights and obligations. 

To clarify, this is about the North American Free Trade Agreement (NAFTA) between the US, Canada, and Mexico. After years of negotiation, it came into force in January 1994.
It's hard to remember, but before NAFTA, the countries had different tariffs for various goods to protect their domestic industries. Imagine how much effort it must have taken to transport goods across borders without smartphones and advanced computers—lots of paperwork and signing. After forming the market, NAFTA reduced the amount of customs duties among the members. It has had a profound effect on trade relations, especially in agriculture; for example, Mexican fruits and vegetables flow into the US.

As a matter of fact, there are both positive and negative impacts on the members. 
Before NAFTA, Mexico was a self-sufficient country, but now it is flooded with US agricultural products and meat, which are cheaper than domestic products. Smaller Mexican domestic agriculture companies have had to close under the cost pressure. Canada is now a major exporter of raw materials but has to fight against environmental exploitation. Completely different in US, for labor cost reduction were jobs relocated from the US to Mexico. 

However, I believe they need to address the problems in the right order to save small producers and ensure overall benefits for all members.

Salary and Benefits

5.2. In addition, Party B is entitled to receive benefits in accordance with Party A’s standard benefit package, as amended from time to time.

Termination of Employment
7.1. Subsequent to completion of the probationary term of employment referred to in paragraph 4 herein, Party A may terminate the employment of Party B at any time:

(a) for just cause at common law, in which case Party B is not entitled to any advance notice of termination or compensation in lieu of notice;

(b) without just cause, in which case Party A shall provide Party B with advance notice of termination or compensation in lieu of notice equal to 1 month plus 2 weeks per year of completed service with Party A, to a maximum of fifteen (15) months.

7.2. Party B may terminate his employment at any time by providing Party A with at least eight (8) weeks advance notice of his intention to resign.

Jurisdiction

Prompt Level: 8.0 [SEP] Prompt: You are a journalist for a financial magazine. You've been asked by your editor to write a report on the performance of the Hang Seng (HSI) stock market index. You have some notes and a graph as your guide. Write an article of 150-200 words, making it as accurate and interesting as possible. [SEP] Response: Steady Growth in Hang Seng Index Signals Positive Outlook for Hong Kong Market

The Hang Seng Index (HSI) in Hong Kong has shown remarkable resilience and steady growth over the past six months, fueled largely by increased investment from Mainland China. After hitting a low of 20,956 points six months ago, the index has climbed steadily, reaching a high of 27,499 recently. This significant rise reflects growing confidence among investors in the region’s economic prospects.

Key contributors to this growth are the Properties and Utilities sub-indices, both of which have surged dramatically. The expansion of these sectors is closely linked to economic growth in Mainland China, where increased demand and infrastructure development have created a ripple effect benefiting Hong Kong’s market.

Experts remain optimistic about the future of the HSI. Predictions indicate that the index is poised to continue its upward trajectory into next year, supported not only by ongoing investment from China but also by new capital inflows from other international investors. Additionally, Hong Kong’s strong internal demand is expected to sustain this positive momentum.

Overall, the Hang Seng Index’s performance signals a robust and expanding financial environment, making it an attractive prospect for both local and global investors.

We propose the development of "Zen," a $4 million boutique hotel that integrates a spa and health & fitness center, targeting the growing demand for wellness-centered weekend getaways. Market research by AccomData Group indicates a clear upward trend in consumers seeking relaxing retreats and prioritizing healthy lifestyles. Moreover, their surveys reveal widespread dissatisfaction with cuisine at existing fitness centers.

Zen will offer a gourmet healthy menu curated by top chefs from renowned restaurants, setting it apart in the market. An intensive media campaign led by Kudos Advertising Agency is planned to ensure high visibility and market traction from launch.

After a period of lackluster performance through September, the HSI showed signs of resilience, closing with gains during the first week of the new month, buoyed by a recovery in the technology and real estate sectors.

While the Hang Seng has room for recovery, market participants should brace for continued swings amid a challenging global economic landscape.

To start with, our new service has to be able to communicate with and integrate into the current mobile network technology. This consists of a network of base stations, the core circuit switched network, which handles voice calls and text, a packet switched network, which handles mobile data, and the public switched telephone network to connect subscribers to the wider telephony network. Prompt Level: 14.0 [SEP] Prompt: You are preparing to brief your troops about the unit’s deployment. Read the information again and make notes on the main points. Type into the input box. Compare your notes with the model text at the end. [SEP] Response: Confidential

PANTASIA – Background Information for Deploying Units

The situation in the Federation of Pantasia began to cause the international community concern a year ago when an election resulted in a vote to break up the federation and form two separate countries for its two main ethnic groups, the Alphas and the Betas. Fighting broke out for control of the mineral-rich Argos Region, as well as between certain minority groups who were made refugees. There is also evidence of an attempt at ethnic cleansing of a minority group.

Six months ago the military staged a coup to reunite the Federation. Although a large portion of the armed forces have returned to Federal control, elements have remained loyal to the new governments of Alpha and Beta. These armies have had small battles between themselves over disputed territories while resisting operations by the Federal forces based in Federal Territory.

Until a month ago the situation was a stalemate, however, the various factions have been rearming under the pretence of negotiations. Recently, strong leadership in Beta has resulted in a campaign that has pinned down Federal forces and Beta forces have also launched an all-out attack through Alpha territory to seize valuable land in Argos.

This has resulted in considerable civilian casualties, refugees and dislocation of population. There are reports of executions, rape, destruction of property and infrastructure. It is also believed that Beta has established concentration camps as part of its ethnic cleansing policy.

Apart from the problems of the ongoing conflicts, there has been the constant threat of hunger for the civilians in the area.  Earlier in the year the weather was unusually cold and dry, which resulted in crop failures. In recent weeks heavy rains have caused flooding and the destruction of bridges, roads and rail links, cutting off some of the most vulnerable villages.

As a result of the conflict and because of humanitarian concerns, Chapter VII of the UN Charter was invoked by a special resolution with strong rules of engagement (ROE) to impose peace, separate the warring factions and provide humanitarian care. An Implementation Phase, involving air power supported by ground troops, will be launched at 0600 hours on Monday unless the factions lay down their arms. This seems increasingly unlikely.

In addition to war-fighting the infantry units will be expected to conduct humanitarian operations, to protect people and improve basic facilities. The Implementation Phase is expected to last one month and then turn into a Stabilization Phase, although it is possible that the war fighting phase will last longer. During the Stabilization Phase, infantry units will be ensuring peace and security while a new government takes over and NGOs enter the country to assist the civilian population. Some units will also be involved in direct humanitarian work.

Confidential

Prompt Level: 8.0 [SEP] Prompt: Listen again to the flight attendant. Type out the whole text of the recording. Compare your text with the model. [SEP] Response: Ensuring safety in flight involves a combination of rigorous planning, adherence to regulations, and real-time vigilance. Key aspects include:

1. **Aircraft Maintenance**: Regular inspections and maintenance per manufacturer and aviation authority guidelines.
2. **Pilot Training**: Comprehensive training and regular recertification for pilots.
3. **Pre-Flight Checks**: Thorough walkarounds, systems checks, and verification of flight plans and weather.
4. **Air Traffic Control (ATC)**: Constant communication with ATC to manage traffic and respond to any in-flight issues.
5. **Weather Monitoring**: Real-time weather assessments before and during flight to avoid turbulence, storms, or other hazards.
6. **Safety Protocols**: Adherence to standard operating procedures, including emergency drills and passenger briefings.
7. **Cabin Crew Preparedness**: Ongoing training in safety procedures, first aid, and emergency response.
8. **Passenger Cooperation**: Ensuring passengers follow safety instructions, including seatbelt use and electronic device rules.
9. **Use of Modern Technology**: Utilizing onboard systems like TCAS (Traffic Collision Avoidance System), EGPWS (Enhanced Ground Proximity Warning System), and autopilot.

Prompt Level: 8.0 [SEP] Prompt: Rewrite the termination section of the contract to take into account possible discrimination either against or by the employer or employee. Compare your amendment with the model. This is a non-graded activity. [SEP] Response: Last month, an interesting lawsuit began that opens a window into our changing economy and, perhaps, our changing society.

John Bottoms, ex-CFO of the US steel conglomerate Big Steel Co., was made redundant due to, in the company’s words, ‘our changing financial climate’. Bottoms had worked in the company for over thirty years and was therefore due a decent severance package. He was, however, only 49 at the time, and would be competing with jobseekers ten or twenty years his junior. Finding another job equal to the one he had lost might prove to be impossible.

It was with this in mind that Bottoms came to a startling decision: turn down the severance package and sue Big Steel Co.

Crazy? Perhaps. Brave? Definitely. Yet Bottoms was only following what is becoming a new trend in the legal area of contracts and employment: unlawful dismissal and unfair severance packages. Over the last five years, the number of employment-related civil court actions – not just in the area of severance disputes, but also sexual harassment, racial discrimination and unfair dismissal – has more than doubled.

The largest increase in these disputes has been for age discrimination. Trends show that employees are staying on in a company longer than previous generations. Yet, companies often want to let go their more elderly staff and invest in youth. Hence the reason for so many disputes. Experts, however, say it might not be the case that there is more discrimination in the workplace than before, rather there is more awareness of the issue.

Whatever the case may be, companies are taking action to guard against future lawsuits. One such action is the purchasing of liability insurance policies which cover potential employment-related claims. Perhaps Big Steel Co. is wishing it had had such a policy in place, as they’re facing a hefty pay-out to a vindicated Bottoms.

Prompt Level: 16.0 [SEP] Prompt: In the preceding units, nine writing techniques were introduced: metaphor, hyperbole, symbolism, free writing, focused free writing, loop writing, listing, questioning and cubing. Write a paragraph or two explaining which techniques seem most useful to you. Type in the input box. Write 150-200 words. [SEP] Response: Free writing and hyperbole are two distinct yet impactful writing techniques used to enhance creativity and expression. Free writing is an unstructured, spontaneous method where a writer writes continuously for a set period without worrying about grammar, spelling, or topic constraints. The goal is to bypass the inner critic and let thoughts flow freely, often leading to unexpected ideas or breakthroughs. It’s commonly used in brainstorming or as a warm-up exercise to overcome writer’s block and encourage raw, authentic expression.
On the other hand, hyperbole is a figurative language technique that involves deliberate and obvious exaggeration for emphasis or effect. It is not meant to be taken literally but rather to create a strong impression or convey intense emotions. For example, saying “I’ve told you a million times” exaggerates to highlight frustration. Hyperbole is widely used in poetry, advertising, and everyday speech to add drama or humor.
While free writing encourages the natural emergence of ideas, hyperbole enhances storytelling by intensifying description. Both techniques serve to unlock creativity and engage the reader in different ways.

Prompt Level: 13.0 [SEP] Prompt: Use the information in the notes to write an informative text about NAFTA, or write about a trade agreement your country is a part of. Type in the input box. Write 150-200 words. [SEP] Response: The North American Free Trade Agreement (NAFTA) was a trade deal between the United States, Canada, and Mexico, implemented on January 1, 1994. It aimed to eliminate tariffs and trade barriers, fostering economic cooperation among the three nations. NAFTA created one of the world's largest free trade zones, boosting trade and investment across North America.

One of its key benefits was the removal of tariffs on many goods, making products cheaper for consumers and businesses. It also helped expand supply chains across borders, particularly in industries like automobiles, agriculture, and manufacturing. However, NAFTA faced criticism for job losses in some sectors, especially in U.S. manufacturing, as companies relocated production to Mexico for lower labor costs.

In 2020, NAFTA was replaced by the United States-Mexico-Canada Agreement (USMCA), which introduced stronger labor protections, updated trade rules for the digital economy, and stricter regulations on the auto industry. While NAFTA played a crucial role in North America's economic growth, the USMCA was designed to address its shortcomings and create a more balanced trade relationship.

Prompt Level: 16.0 [SEP] Prompt: In the preceding units, nine writing techniques were introduced: metaphor, hyperbole, symbolism, free writing, focused free writing, loop writing, listing, questioning and cubing. Write a paragraph or two explaining which techniques seem most useful to you. Type in the input box. Write 150-200 words. [SEP] Response: Among the nine writing techniques introduced, I find focused free writing and questioning to be the most useful. Focused free writing allows me to explore a topic in depth without worrying about structure or grammar, which helps me uncover ideas I didn’t know I had. It’s especially helpful when I’m stuck or unsure how to begin a piece. By narrowing my attention to a specific subject, I can generate meaningful content while still maintaining the freedom to express myself creatively.
Questioning is another technique I rely on often. Asking questions like “Why does this matter?” or “What would happen if…?” helps me dig deeper into a topic and develop a stronger argument or narrative. It encourages critical thinking and helps me see different angles, which is essential for persuasive or reflective writing. While techniques like metaphor and symbolism add flair, I believe focused free writing and questioning are foundational tools that help shape the core of my ideas. They make the writing process more engaging and productive, especially during the early stages of brainstorming and drafting.

Prompt Level: 8.0 [SEP] Prompt: You are a medical resident who writes a blog about the health industry. One of your readers has asked you a question. Read the question, then write a suitable answer. Write 150-200 words. [SEP] Response: 
What’s it like to be a doctor?

Doctors work in diverse environments, from busy hospitals to small clinics. The days can be unpredictable, with a mix of patient care, paperwork, and team collaboration. Each case tests your knowledge and empathy, but seeing someone recover or being there for families makes it worthwhile.
Career Options

Medicine offers various paths:

•	Primary care: Family medicine, internal medicine, pediatrics.
•	Specialties: Surgery, psychiatry, anesthesiology, cardiology, and neurology.
•	Non-clinical: Research, teaching, medical writing, policy-making.

Medical Training:

Training is rigorous. Clinical training—rotations in different specialties—is intense, with long shifts and steep learning curves. But you gain skills and confidence over time.

Salary as a Trainee:

As an intern, resident, or fellow, you do get paid. It’s usually enough for basic living, though not extravagant -> expect to budget carefully. The financial rewards improve after training.

Clinic vs. Hospital Life:

Hospitals are fast-paced, sometimes hectic. Clinics are generally steadier and allow for developing ongoing relationships with patients.

If you love science, want to help others, and can persevere, medicine could be a great fit for you!

All the best,

Anika

Prompt Level: 15.0 [SEP] Prompt: You're going to write about an interesting, fictional event that happened to a friend. Write your blog post. Type in the input box. Write 150-200 words. [SEP] Response: Last weekend, my friend Alex experienced something truly bizarre that I just *had* to share. She was visiting an art gallery in the city, an experience she had been looking forward to for weeks. As she wandered through the exhibit, admiring a modern painting that seemed to change colors in the light, she felt a tap on her shoulder. 

Turning around, she was surprised to find no one there. Thinking it was just someone passing by, she turned back to the artwork, but then… it happened again. Another tap, this time a little more deliberate. She spun around, but still no one was in sight. Feeling a mix of confusion and curiosity, Alex stepped closer to the painting. As she stood there, trying to figure out what was going on, the lights in the room flickered and then dimmed. 

Suddenly, she felt the tap again, this time on her wrist. Before she could react, she heard a voice whisper, “Don’t look too closely.” 

Alex didn’t waste any time — she left the exhibit faster than I’ve ever seen anyone move. I don’t think I’d go back either…

Prompt Level: 16.0 [SEP] Prompt: Write a paragraph describing how robots are being used in your country. How do you feel about them? In what ways will they positively and negatively affect society? Type in the input box. Write 150-200 words. [SEP] Response: Some look to the stars to spot signs of life on other planets. Others look for signs of a different kind, to the omens and portents they hope will foretell of riches a-waiting, relationships a-coming and fame a-calling. Some look upward to the heavens for such signs; others, inward to visions and inspiration. And the rest of us may look downward at more humble and homely teacups, tarot cards and talismans to find what the future might hold in store.

By no means a 21st-century phenomenon, means of divining the future have long been part of traditional cultures around the world. People have scoured their dreams for symbols that might unlock what’s around the corner. Some societies have looked to Mother Nature for guidance, reading the entrails of animals or the shapes formed by clouds, shadows cast by stones or yarrow stalks, or scanned upturned palms and faces. These forms of divination have often been associated with people believed, or who believe themselves, to have special gifts of extrasensory perception, or second sight. The role of the priest or priestess, shaman or magician is still central in many societies today, though their responsibilities may now also include here-and-now concerns as well as forebodings.

Throughout history, particular people have been associated with clairvoyant or clairaudient abilities. For the rationalists, these people are no more than charlatans who offer vague and cryptic messages, veiled in metaphor and imagery, open to variable interpretations. To those who feel there is more to this world than the physical eyes can show us, such messengers hold the key to unlocking the future trajectory of our world, and offer hope of averting dangers yet to come.

One such individual is Nostradamus. Controversy and criticism surround what is known of him. Born Michel de Nostredame in France in the early 16th century, he Latinized his name to Nostradamus for personal reasons. Often depicted as a physician, some historians claim he was thrown out of medical university. On one thing most would agree, however: Nostradamus was an astrologer, looking to the movement of the planets and people’s times of birth to draw up his prognostications. But he has perhaps gained most notoriety not for his glimpses into personal lives, but for his revelations about the future through quatrains, or verse-like commentary.

Attributed to Nostradamus with the benefit of what naysayers call retrospective hindsight are prophesies of world wars, numerous famines and disasters, man’s landing on the moon and the recent collapse of world economies. For non-believers, however, these verses are no more than the ramblings of a man deluded, and the application of creative interpretation on the part of those who wish to believe in Nostradamus’ clairvoyance. Linguists argue his messages were wrapped in such obscurity and metaphorical language that the doors of perception were left wide open for the public to make of them what they would. They point to the wealth of phrases such as ‘and the young lion shall overcome the old’ as his means to figuratively (and some would say, therefore, evasively) refer to a wide spread of people and nations. But when the times get tough and bad things happen to good people, many look to Nostradamus’ writings, imagining they foretold this writing on the wall and heralded apocalyptic news.

How did Nostradamus make these predictions supposedly ranging from technological advances to world destruction? Reportedly, he stared into water or fire to see these visions, though more extreme believers claim the man was a time traveler! Perhaps there is only one thing we can be truly certain of, however: The debate about the meaning of Nostradamus’ work will continue for as long we have a future!

Prompt Level: 16.0 [SEP] Prompt: In the preceding units, nine writing techniques were introduced: metaphor, hyperbole, symbolism, free writing, focused free writing, loop writing, listing, questioning and cubing. Write a paragraph or two explaining which techniques seem most useful to you. Type in the input box. Write 150-200 words. [SEP] Response: Among various writing methods, I find free writing and metaphor to be particularly useful. Free writing allows writers to tap into their subconscious mind, generating new ideas and perspectives. By writing freely without stopping or worrying about grammar, spelling, or coherence, writers can overcome writer's block and produce authentic content. This method helps to loosen up the writing muscles, making it easier to express thoughts and feelings.

Metaphor, on the other hand, enables writers to convey complex ideas and emotions in a concise and powerful way. By comparing two unlike things, metaphors create vivid imagery, making writing more engaging and memorable. Metaphors also allow writers to convey subtle shades of meaning, adding depth and nuance to their writing. When combined with free writing, metaphors can help writers to create rich, evocative, and authentic content that resonates with readers. Metaphorical writing uses comparisons to create vivid and evocative language, often to convey complex emotions and ideas.
